programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton help Ginny Lunn search for a holiday home in Dorset or on the Costa Tropical in Spain, with each property expert showing her three options.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help a couple with four children that want to move to the coast to decide between living in Cornwall and Mallorca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps recently retired Nick and Jane Purser decide between a move to Lancaster or Marseillan in southern France.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to reverse the fortunes of a diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Line of Duty, Mary Berry's Easter Feast, Saturday Night Takeaway, University Challenge, Big Little Lies, The Toilet: An Unspoken History, The Dog with an IQ of 102, and the News.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.title: The Super Orgasm
programme.desc: For most women multiple orgasms can seem almost mythical. But some can experience it not once, twice or even 10 times, but 60, 70 or 100 - a super-orgasm. In this documentary, a group of these women volunteer for a series of tests in a scientific investigation to reveal the truth behind the super-orgasm. The aim is to measure and record the phenomenon for the first time, finding out how the brain and the body react before, during and after, and asking if these women are wired differently to other people. And if not, is it something that could be learned by anyone?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. Senior healthcare play specialist Tracy talks about her job, which is to comfort and distract children during their treatment in A&E, and 83-year-old Audrey arrives with her grandson Lee after damaging her wrist while falling on holiday.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: It took 30-year-old Louise and her husband Andy six years to conceive. Now they're looking forward to meeting their baby and showing it off to their worried family and health care assistant Olwen. Cameras also follow Sammy, 23, who is about to have her third child. An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: An insight into the Mormon community of Rockland Ranch, Utah, where women choose their husbands through an inspiration from God, and men try to prove themselves worthy and wait to be selected. The documentary provides rare access to the residents' rites, rituals and daily lives.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: New series. This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny hit the road with some stained-glass windows, and decide to add an extra load in the shape of a giant fish sculpture. But they struggle to get it into the van.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps recently retired Nick and Jane Purser decide between a move to Lancaster or Marseillan in southern France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Laura Hamilton help three generations of the same family who are on the move together. Whatever they finally decide, there must be room for grandad as well.(n)

programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are currently renting because they have sold their home. While Jeanette is quite certain she would like to settle in Cornwall, Bob has got itchy feet and wants to move to southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a married couple decide where to spend their retirement. Gail wants to return to her roots and move to the west coast of Scotland, but Clive is craving some sun and likes the look of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two young couples who were looking to take their all-important first steps on the property ladder in London. First, Phil meets Cat and Ed, who were searching for a home in the area around Chiswick, before revisiting Ian and Sarah, who were in love with the idea of finding a property in Balham.(n)

programme.title: Killer Psychopaths
programme.desc: Former prison governor and criminologist David Wilson examines the motivations of serial killers, travelling to where they grew up and visiting the scenes of their crimes. He begins with Joanna Dennehy, a Peterborough mother-of-two who was responsible for the murder of three men in the space of 10 days in March 2013. Dennehy's ex-partner John Treanor speaks candidly to the cameras, and there are also interviews with CPS prosecutor Chris McCann, crime reporter Ben Kendall and Chiara and Dino Lee, whose father Kevin was one of her victims.(n)

programme.title: Killer Psychopaths
programme.desc: John Duffy and David Mulcahy were a rare example of two serial killers working together when they were responsible for a series of rapes and murders across London during the 1980s, targeting lone women at train stations. Visiting key locations and speaking to those involved in the case, criminologist David Wilson delves into Duffy's and Mulcahy's pasts to explain how underlying psychopathy and frustrations in their relationships drove them to carry out numerous sexual assaults, which in time escalated to murder.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior's family rallies round to help him deal with a school bully, but only succeed in making matters worse. Meanwhile, baby Kady develops a strange new habit.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection. Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy try to collect a debt from a technology company, but with the director nowhere to be seen, the office manager does everything she can to prove the business is no longer trading. Stewart McCracken and Elmor Victor face a heartbreaking house repossession in Merseyside, where two landlords are forced to evict a tenant recovering from a brain tumour which has cost him his job and income.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner get caught up in a dispute between a landlord and a tenant who refuses to move out, and Brian O'Shaughnessy and Delroy Anglin chase a £17,000 debt. Meanwhile, in Essex, a couple owe their neighbour £11,000, and on the south coast, debt collection from a Turkish restaurant gets complicated when there is confusion about ownership.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In this special episode, the High Court enforcement agents have to deal with a fraudulent tenant, an evasive debtor and a mother in denial. Steve and Ben are in west London to see a tenant who owes £14,000 in unpaid rent, but when they gain access to the property they discover the house has divided up like a hotel and is being sublet. In Sussex, Brian and Del chase a debt of over £10,000 owed to a van rental business for damaged vehicles, before heading to Kent to try to reclaim £6,000 of unpaid rent from a woman financially dependent on a new partner after a disastrous divorce.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In south London, father-and-son team Del and Dael Anglin face death threats from a debtor's father, after arriving at a property to collect a debt of over £3,500. Meanwhile, in east London, two agents are confronted with a tenant who claims to have had no prior warning that he is being evicted from his tiny bedsit. Del and Brian try to recover £6,000 owed by a London hotel to a catering supply company, and Paul and Steve must tackle a difficult eviction.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on former members of the armed forces. Nigel left the Army in 1997, having served tours in Bosnia and Northern Ireland. He has been struggling to adapt to civilian life ever since and now runs a support group for others in a similar situation. Andrew was a Royal Navy engineer and now lives in Truro, but has had to stop working due to chronic breathing difficulties, and Anthony, who left the Duke of Lancaster regiment after standing on an IED, is now hoping for ground-breaking treatment to help him walk again.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: And a Baby on the Way.
programme.desc: The documentary series meets three mothers trying to raise their children on benefits. Amy recently moved to the Isle of Wight with her partner to be close to his family, only to end up living alone with her two children. Single mum Natasha from Camberley is expecting her second child and struggles to get by, often missing meals so she can afford to feed her 16-month-old son, while Essex mum Becky receives £450 per month and enjoys a life beyond her means, typically spending £500 on her daughter at Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Two more families swap places for a week, getting a taste of each other's lives in rural Essex and inner-city London. The Heasemans live in a luxurious farmhouse with six acres of land. The Webbs rent a maisonette in a tower block that is so small, eldest son Marcus is confined to the sofa in the living room. How will both families find their new living arrangements - and the accompanying budgets?.(n)

programme.title: Death Sentence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered executive Nick Hume's perfect, peaceful life is destroyed when his oldest son is killed by a street gang. Hume becomes determined to see those responsible pay for their crimes, gaining the sympathy and support of a homicide detective working on the case. However, she begins to question her position as Hume's methods of retribution become increasingly violent. Thriller, starring Kevin Bacon, Kelly Preston and Garrett Hedlund.(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Produced by Tom Hanks, written by Aaron Sorkin, and directed by Mike Nichols, this adaptation of George Crile III's incendiary bestseller tells the remarkable story of the Texas congressman whose efforts to prevent the Red Army from overtaking Afghanistan eventually led to the collapse of the Soviet Union while simultaneously fueling the rise of radical Islam. In the early 1980s, a hastily assembled army of Afghan "freedom fighters" achieved the remarkable feat of fending off Soviet invaders despite the fact that the odds were overwhelmingly stacked against them. At the time, Texas congressman Charlie Wilson (Hanks) was a key member of the hugely powerful House Appropriations Committee. Illuminated to the specifics of this remarkable war by a high-profile Houston socialite, Wilson spearheaded an effort to provide hundreds of millions of dollars in weapons and training to the Mujahideen with more than a little help from brilliant but prickly CIA operative Gust Avrokotos(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Zany horror spoof about a brilliant brain surgeon who falls in love with a female brain stored in a jar. The brain is part of an impressive collection held by a colleague in Austria and, after learning of his wife's infidelity, the surgeon allows himself to be charmed. Communicating telepathically with one of the specimens in the laboratory, he falls in love - but needs a body to put it in(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Household servant Willard, sick of the meanness of his millionairess employer, snaffles her hound Muffin but botches the job so hopelessly that everyone thinks that he's been kidnapped(n)

programme.title: I Spy

programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: A man whose ideals have been shattered for the last time is out for violent justice in this thriller. Creasy (Denzel Washington) is a former United State intelligence agent-turned-mercenary who has seen too much of the violence and corruption in the world and has become jaded and withdrawn. Creasy is hired to act as a bodyguard for Lupita (nicknamed "Pita", played by (Dakota Fanning), a ten-year-old girl whose wealthy family (a Mexican father and American mother) currently lives in Mexico City, where kidnapping has become a near epidemic. While watching over Pita, Creasy becomes fond of the girl, and finds himself regaining some of his faith in humanity. But things take an ugly turn when Pita is abducted by gunmen who shoot Creasy and leave him to die in the streets. Enraged beyond reason, Creasy recovers and sets out to find the men responsible for kidnapping Pita, no matter who he has to kill along the way. Man on Fire is based on a novel by A.J. Quinnell, which was previously filmed in 1987 with Scott Glenn as Creasy. Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell, Giancarlo Giannini, and Mickey Rourke highlight the supporting cast for this remake(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic ex-marine finds a new life on the distant planet of Pandora, only to find himself battling humankind alongside the planet's indigenous Na'vi race in this ambitious digital 3D sci-fi epic from Academy Award-winning Titanic director James Cameron. The film, which marks Cameron's first dramatic feature since 1997's Titanic, follows Jake Sully (Sam Worthington), a war veteran who gets called to the depths of space to pick up the job of his slain twin brother for the scientific arm of a megacorporation looking to mine the planet of Pandora for a valued ore. Unfortunately the biggest deposit of the prized substance lies underneath the home of the Na'vi, a ten-foot-tall, blue-skinned native tribe who have been at war with the security arm of the company, lead by Col. Miles Quaritch (Stephen Lang). Because of the planet's hostile atmosphere, humans have genetically grown half-alien/half-human bodies which they can jack their consciousnesses into and explore the world in. Since Jake's brother already had an incredibly expensive Avatar grown for him, he's able to connect with it using the same DNA code and experience first-hand the joys of Pandora while giving the scientific team, led by Grace Augustine (Sigourney Weaver) and Norm Spellman (Joel David Moore), some well-needed protection against the planet's more hostile forces. On a chance meeting after getting separated from his team, Jake's Avatar is rescued by Neytiri (Zoe Saldana), a Na'vi princess, who brings him into her tribe in order to give the humans a second chance at relating to this new environment. When word gets out of his increasing time with the alien species, Quaritch enlists Jake to do some reconnaissance for the company, as they'd like to persuade the tribe to move their home before taking more drastic measures to harness the treasure hidden below. Yet as Jake becomes one with the tribe and begins to understand the secrets of Pandora, his conscience is torn between his new adopted world and the wheelchair-bound one awaiting him when the psychic connection to his Avatar is broken. Soon battle lines are drawn and Jake needs to decide which side he will fight on when the time comes. The film was shot on the proprietary FUSION digital 3D cameras developed by Cameron in collaboration with Vince Pace, and offers a groundbreaking mix of live-action dramatic performances and computer-generated effects. The revolutionary motion-capture system created for the film allows the facial expressions of actors to be captured as a virtual camera system enables them to see what their computer-generated counterparts will be seeing in the film, and Peter Jackson's Oscar-winning Weta Digital visual-effects house supervises Avatar's complex special effects(n)

programme.desc: An A-list actor and his posse of best buds navigate the perils and pleasures of Hollywood life(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul WS Anderson tunes-up Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" in this action flick about a contest pitting a convict against other convicts, with the winner walking off with his freedom(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A suburban couple returning to their semi-secluded house after attending a wedding finds their lives suddenly thrown into chaos with the arrival of three malevolent, masked strangers in director Bryan Bertino's tense tale of survival. Liv Tyler and Scott Speedman star as the couple forced to resort to violence they never thought themselves capable of as they struggle for their lives, and model-turned-actress Gemma Ward continues her transition from the catwalk to the silver screen as one of the merciless masked invaders(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A mysterious videotape surfaces, leaving anyone who views it with just seven days to live. Can journalist Rachel Keller solve the mystery without falling victim to its deadly curse?(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge"(n)

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: For the right price, ex-Special Forces officer Frank Martin will take anything anywhere. He just has three rules: no changes to the plan; no real names; no opening the package... until one package starts to move. Inside it is the beautiful Lai and, although Martin delivers her to the unscrupulous Darren "Wall Street" Bettencourt, his conscience soon gets the better of him and he decides to track down Wall Street and his masters and rescue Lai…(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Network feature film(n)

programme.title: Wagons East!
programme.desc: Comedy western about a wagon train boss who is hired to lead a bunch of fed-up pioneers back to the East. But first they must get past the gunslingers paid to stop them by a railway baron who reckons that others could copy the Eastward trend. John Candy died before the film's completion(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: Giddy, crowd-pleasing romp about an English teenager whose dreams of soccer stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

programme.desc: Reaction to the latest results.(n)

programme.title: Raceday Live
programme.desc: Coverage of meetings at Ffos Las, Plumpton, Southwell, Cork and Fairyhouse.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt serves as host this weekend, as food scientist Mich Turner and chef Tom Kitchin prepare dishes for Grow Your Own Drugs host James Wong.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Absolute Favourites
programme.desc: The veteran cook draws on her wealth of specialist knowledge to share a selection of her recipes, each inspired by a different place. In the first programme, she recalls childhood trips to the seaside, preparing goats cheese and shallot tarts with an innovative walnut pastry, considered ideal for a picnic hamper. She moves on to a family favourite - royal crab and cod fishcakes with tomato salsa, followed by a dinner party classic of sea bass with brown shrimp and caper sauce.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's headlines and look ahead to forthcoming fixtures, while there are also interviews with Fernando Torres and Didier Drogba.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: The afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre, where two more first-round matches get under way - Ronnie O'Sullivan v Gary Wilson and Kyren Wilson v David Grace. Nine frames are scheduled to take place on each table and the players will be looking to ensure they are at least still in with a chance of progressing to the last 16 when they come back to the famous theatre tomorrow to conclude their fixtures. Plus, updates from the morning's play. Presented by Hazel Irvine.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of complete strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Richard Madeley and his daughter Chloe, JLS star JB and his wife Chloe, Fern Britton and her daughter Grace Jones, and B*Witched twins Keavy and Edele Lynch take part in a families-themed edition of the unorthodox quiz show. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: New series. Peter Capaldi's eccentric, era-hopping Time Lord returns for his final series. However, before he hands over the key to the Tardis to his as-yet-undecided successor, there's the matter of the girl with a star in her eye to deal with. A chance encounter brings Bill Potts into contact with the Doctor, who is conducting a secret mission on Earth. What follows is a terrifying chase across time and space, one that opens Bill's mind to the prospect of a bigger and wider universe than she'd ever imagined. Pearl Mackie makes her debut Doctor Who appearance as new companion Bill, while Matt Lucas also stars as the Doctor's old ally Nardole.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stan Cullen hopes to escape the tyranny of a bullying boss by burning down a building on a secure construction site. However, he is unaware that his wife Tamzin has the same goal in mind, and happens to be inside the building he has set ablaze. Meanwhile, Cal confronts Sam, claiming he has been intimidating Lily into working overtime, and Jez wakes to find himself in the bed of Elle's 17-year-old son Kalen, resulting in a tense stand-off in the ED.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes Brown and her brood are joined in their studio-home by another selection of famous faces, including comedian and presenter Sue Perkins and Diversity's Ashley Banjo, who brings his mum Danielle to meet the formidable Irish matriarch. Former Silent Witness star Emilia Fox, most recently seen trying to solve the mystery of The Missing Crown Jewels in Ant and Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, becomes the latest unsuspecting star to join Dermot and Buster on their Celebrity Tour venture, and Aston Merrygold - whose latest single Show Me was released last month - provides this week's music.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, which include Tottenham Hotspur v Bournemouth at White Hart Lane, and Southampton v Manchester City at St Mary's Stadium. The outcome of these matches could yet prove to be crucial at the end of the season for both Spurs and the Citizens, as they continue to battle for a place in the top four.(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dawn
programme.desc: A fighter pilot is shot down over enemy territory during the Vietnam War and endures a harrowing incarceration in a prisoner of war camp. Determined to escape, he rallies his fellow captives to mount a daring break-out and together they embark on a desperate journey through the jungle. Werner Herzog's drama, starring Christian Bale, Steve Zahn and Jeremy Davies.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, which include Tottenham Hotspur v Bournemouth at White Hart Lane, and Southampton v Manchester City at St Mary's Stadium. The outcome of these matches could yet prove to be crucial at the end of the season for both Spurs and the Citizens, as they continue to battle for a place in the top four.(n)

programme.title: Easter Sunday Worship
programme.sub-title: Easter Day Service - Live from Hereford Cathedral.
programme.desc: A traditional Eucharist from Hereford Cathedral, led by the Bishop of Hereford. The mass setting is Rheinberger's Messe misericordias Domini, sung by the Hereford Cathedral Choir.(n)

programme.title: Urbi et Orbi
programme.desc: Martin Bashir introduces Pope Francis' Easter message and blessing live from St Peter's Square in Rome.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Bolsover, Wolverhampton and Plaistow, as they prepare to sell them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The competition heads to Lincoln, where antiques experts Charles Hanson and Paul Laidlaw help two teams of pilots and sky divers search for potentially valuable items to take to auction. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott takes a trip to the Geffrye Museum in London.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven, Jules Hudson, Keeley Donovan and Margherita Taylor file their final reports centred on the arrival of spring, and look forward to summer.(n)

programme.title: Cool Runnings
programme.desc: A sprinter fails to qualify for the Jamaican Olympic squad, but refuses to give up his dream. Learning that a former US bobsleigh coach is living nearby, he seizes the chance to shine in an entirely different sport, and cajoles three of his friends to join him in training for the 1988 Winter Olympics in the far less tropical environment of Canada. Fact-based comedy, with John Candy, Leon, Doug E Doug and Malik Yoba.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: The last in a set of four documentaries exploring wildlife and plants throughout the year focuses on the spring, when hibernating animals awake and many species search for mates. The programme features footage of grizzly bear cubs, the mating dances of grebes, flowers growing in the desert and swifts embarking on marathon journeys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sian Williams presents an appeal on behalf of Hope Support Services, a charity set up to provide support for the children of people with life-threatening illnesses.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sally Magnusson presents a special episode for Easter Sunday, revealing how people from across Greater Manchester have come together for a performance of the crucifixion.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team journey south to the oldest islands in the Galapagos to see the impact humans have had on this pristine wilderness. Moving on to the island of Isabela, Liz descends into a vertical lava cave, then makes her final land-based stop on Santa Cruz, where she meets a man on a mission to protect the giant tortoise population. Finally, she dives into the deep blue waters to witness the birth of a new island. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker takes part in a pace egg rolling challenge in Lancashire and meets an artist who decorates eggs for a living, while Anita Rani follows a walk through the region's hills set up to commemorate the witch trials that occurred 400 years ago. Steve Brown visits Brockholes nature reserve in the hope of seeing boxing hares, Adam Henson goes shopping for pigs, and Tom Heap reports on an MRSA outbreak in Denmark. Including weather for the week ahead.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns for a second episode from Pembroke Castle in West Wales. Items brought in to be valued include a sapphire ring that changes colour in different light, a papal hat that once belonged to Pope Pius XII, and a collection of Anglo-Indian paintings from 1780 that were once used to decorate a village's scout hut.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Nick Huntley is brought in for questioning by AC-12, but denies any involvement in Steve's attack. However, the interrogation leads him to question how honest his wife has been with him. New anomalies emerge in the forensic evidence which cast further suspicion on Roz - who responds by dismantling the detectives' case with inside information of her own.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the day's Premier League action, featuring West Bromwich Albion v Liverpool at The Hawthorns, and Manchester United v Chelsea at Old Trafford. Plus, a round-up of all the goals and talking points from yesterday's fixtures, and a look at the latest headlines.(n)

programme.title: I'm Different: Let Me Drive
programme.desc: An autistic driver from Edinburgh passes his test, but finds his parents do not want him to drive their car on his own, so takes a pass plus test to put their fears at rest. Another autistic learner suffers from uncontrollable twitches, and has a hard time keeping both hands on the wheel.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Up Periscope
programme.desc: A US Navy frogman is ordered to steal a vital Japanese code book from a Pacific island - but the captain of the submarine entrusted with taking him into enemy waters disapproves of the plan, causing tensions to rise and threatening the mission's success. Second World War adventure, with James Garner, Edmond O'Brien and Alan Hale Jr.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: German scientists in occupied Norway during the Second World War begin work on the manufacture of vital components for an atomic bomb, prompting the Norwegian resistance to team up with British forces on a campaign of sabotage to halt production. Second World War thriller, starring Kirk Douglas, Richard Harris, Anton Diffring, Roy Dotrice and Ulla Jacobson.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: The opening session on day one of the sport's flagship event at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two matches in the first round, featuring Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire on one table and Mark Selby beginning the defence of the title he won for the second time last year on the other against Fergal O'Brien. Presented by Hazel Irvine, with a commentary team including Stephen Hendry, Dennis Taylor and Peter Ebdon.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Clare Balding is joined by Chris Hoy and Joanna Rowsell Shand to present live coverage of day four at Hong Kong Velodrome. Today's action will feature the men's omnium, which is taking place in its new one-day format, as well as the conclusion of the individual sprint competitions, as well as the women's madison, which is taking place at the World Championships for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn, and Carol Klein continues her series on her gardening heroes when she visits Waterperry Gardens to find out about the legacy of Beatrix Havergal. Frances Tophill selects her Golden Jubilee plant, Flo Headlam visits a garden centre in Manchester which is run by the local community, and there is a return to Adam Frost's garden, where he gives advice on how to rid borders of bindweed.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Continued coverage of the first round on day one at the Crucible Theatre, with nine frames scheduled to be played on each table, and Ronnie O'Sullivan and Kyren Wilson in action.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates unusual natural events, with the help of eyewitness accounts, scientists and footage of the occurrences.(n)

programme.title: Easter from King's
programme.desc: A selection of music and Gospel readings for Holy Week and Easter, as part of a week of celebrations held at the Chapel of King's College, Cambridge. The King's College Choir, directed by Stephen Cleobury, sings a variety of popular seasonal choral verses, including God So Loved the World, Ubi Caritas, and Hallelujah from Handel's Messiah. Mezzo-soprano Kiandra Howarth joins the choir for a performance of the Easter Hymn from Mascagni's opera Cavalleria rustanica, and the story of Jesus' death and resurrection is related via readings from the King James Bible, and the poems of Phineas Fletcher, Edmund Spenser, and the former Archbishop of Canterbury Dr Rowan Williams.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Coverage of the concluding session on the opening day of the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where Mark Selby v Fergal O'Brien and Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire reach a conclusion. Selby is given the honour of being involved in the first fixture of the tournament in his role as reigning champion, but will be well aware that several winners have fallen at the first hurdle the following year, as the unique pressure of defending the title in the intimate surroundings of the Crucible have their effect.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Paul Murton learns how the Highlands became a popular tourist destination when transport links improved in the 20th century. He begins his journey on the shores of Loch Tay in Perthshire, continues through the Rannoch Moor wilderness, climbs the mountain of Buachaille Etive Mor and ends in the spa town of Strathpeffer.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and Sergeant Wilson are trapped in the bank vault with an unexploded bomb - so the Home Guard heroes try to defuse the situation without their savings going up in flames. Jimmy Perry and David Croft's classic wartime comedy, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn. First broadcast in 1969.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.(n)

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: A divorced father's rare weekend with his two estranged children descends into horror when alien war machines rise from beneath Earth and begin to systematically destroy every human being in their path - leaving the man with the dangerous task of getting his kids to safety. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi thriller, based on HG Wells' novel, with Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Miranda Otto and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the evening session at the Crucible Theatre, where Mark Selby v Fergal O'Brien and Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire were scheduled to conclude.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of the first-round matches from the opening day of the final ranking tournament of the season at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson attends a flower school in Edinburgh, where he learns tips and tricks to put together some unique arrangements with spring flowers. Jim McColl and George also test whether to dig their vegetable plots, which stand side-by-side, with one having been dug over and the other untouched.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn, and Carol Klein continues her series on her gardening heroes when she visits Waterperry Gardens to find out about the legacy of Beatrix Havergal. Frances Tophill selects her Golden Jubilee plant, Flo Headlam visits a garden centre in Manchester which is run by the local community, and there is a return to Adam Frost's garden, where he gives advice on how to rid borders of bindweed.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team are in Holderness in the east Riding of Yorkshire, where Matt Baker and Anita Rani visit Spurn Island, an area separated from the mainland by the storm surge of 2013. Matt meets a lifeboat crew, while Anita goes in search of the island's wildlife. John Craven meets a photographer documenting farming communities on Sunk Island, while Adam Henson and Tom Heap report on dairy farming.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: The opening session on day two at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Kyren Wilson v David Grace and the start of Shaun Murphy v Yan Bingtao. This is the final ranking tournament of another fascinating season, and predicting the destination of the title is not a straightforward task, with the strength in depth in the sport at an all-time high. Presented by Jason Mohammad.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures, which include Manchester United v Chelsea.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces action from the fourth day at Hong Kong Velodrome, which featured the women's keirin, and the final event of the men's madison.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Coverage of the second session on the second day at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where two first-round matches are set to take to the tables - Ronnie O'Sullivan v Gary Wilson and Stuart Bingham v Peter Ebdon. O'Sullivan's match is scheduled to reach a conclusion, with the winner requiring 10 frames to progress, while Bingham gets his fixture under way as he aims to win the title for the second time in three years. Presented by Hazel Irvine, with a commentary team including Ken Doherty, Willie Thorne and John Virgo.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the UK's largest sports shoe factory to see how 3,500 pairs of trainers are made every day, before meeting the man who comes up with the latest designs. Cherry Healey gets hands-on in a tannery, helping to process thousands of rawhides into finished leather for the nation's shoes, and finds out how a ballet company painstakingly create 250,000 ballet shoes per year. Ruth Goodman reveals how, when the sewing machine was first introduced into shoe factories in the mid-19th century, traditional shoemakers went on strike to rebel against joining a restrictive production line.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the grand final. Robots Aftershock, Eruption, Ironside 3, Concussion and Carbide have all made it through to this stage, and will be joined in the arena by an unconfirmed wild card selected by judges Professor Sethu Vijayakumar, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Noel Sharkey. The teams must fight through two group battles and a mini-league before this year's champion is announced. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Rory Reid take a road trip across Cuba in a pair of second-hand sports cars, Matt LeBlanc test drives the Mercedes-AMG GT R supercar, and Ross Noble takes to the track as this week's Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.(n)

programme.title: Colombia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The presenter explores the country as 50 years of civil war draws to a close in the wake of a recently signed peace deal. He meets guerrilla fighters who have pledged to lay down arms, but also discovers a negative consequence of their disarming, as the paramilitary gangs that control the drugs trade grow in power. Simon travels through the country with coca farmers, who discuss the government support they will need in the turbulent times ahead, as poverty and land ownership becoming pressing issues.(n)

programme.title: At Any Price
programme.desc: Premiere. A farmer strives to grow his family business by any means necessary, but his rebellious youngest son proves a constant disappointment, more interested in pursuing a career as a racing driver than helping with the farm. When a series of crises threaten the family's future, father and son must learn to put aside their differences to avert the disaster. Drama, starring Dennis Quaid and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad introduces the evening session at the Crucible Theatre, which featured two matches in the first round - Marco Fu v Luca Brecel and Mark Allen v Jimmy Robertson.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis continues his journey in Iran, the first time a BBC crew has been allowed into the country for nearly 10 years. He visits Persepolis, the city that was at the heart of the Persian empire, before following an ancient caravan route through the desert. Along the way, he stops at a Zoroastrian temple before arriving at Istanbul, where he discovers the influence the silk trade had on the Roman empire, and finally returns to Venice, where he visits Marco Polo's house. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Tankies: Tank Heroes of World War II
programme.sub-title: The Men and the Machines That Beat Hitler.
programme.desc: Part one of two. BBC diplomatic editor and former army officer Mark Urban examines the exploits of six members of the 5th Royal Tank Regiment during the Second World War, beginning in northern France, where in 1940 rookie driver Gerry Solomon joined veterans including Jake Wardrop and Harry Finlayson. He follows in the soldiers' tracks across the deserts of North Africa, where he looks at the battles of Sidi Rezegh, Alam el Halfa and El Alamein, which changed the course of the conflict. With archive footage, including rarely seen colour film, as well as first-hand testimony from surviving veterans and letters and diaries.(n)

programme.title: Department Q: The Absent One
programme.desc: Premiere. Two detectives who run the Copenhagen police's cold case division are driven to reopen a child murder that occurred at an exclusive boarding school in the 1990s after the victims' father commits suicide. Crime thriller based on the novel by Jussi Adler-Olsen, starring Nikolaj Lie Kaas, Fares Fares and Pilou Asbaek. In French and Danish.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with music by David Grant, Level 42, the Creatures, Lotus Eaters and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: Chas & Dave: Last Orders
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into Chas Hodges and Dave Peacock's successful five decades in the music industry, which has seen them share the same bill as Led Zeppelin and make a big impact on London's cultural landscape. The film blends archive performances with more recent tour footage and features contributions by Pete Doherty, Jools Holland and Phill Jupitus. Narrated by Arthur Smith.(n)

programme.title: London Songs at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of performances from the BBC archives celebrating the sights and sounds of London. The programme includes Petula Clark singing A Foggy Day in London Town in 1965, and Adele performing her love letter to the city, Hometown Glory, in October 2007. Also featuring the Jam, Eddy Grant, Tom Paxton and Lily Rose Cooper (Lily Allen).(n)

programme.title: Squeeze: Take Me I'm Yours
programme.desc: The story of how Chris Difford and Glenn Tilbrook formed rock band Squeeze in 1974 and had their first top 20 single four years later with Take Me I'm Yours. The pair discuss writing and recording many of the group's greatest songs, and reflect on the highs and lows of their friendship. Featuring contributions by former band members Jools Holland and Paul Carrack, as well as Elvis Costello, Mark Knopfler and Aimee Mann.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, featuring ZZ Top, U2, Bruce Springsteen, Bon Jovi, INXS, the Cult, the Mission and Motorhead.(n)

programme.title: Messiah at the Foundling Hospital
programme.desc: Handel's Messiah is one of the most popular choral pieces in Western music, yet few people know the story of how this much-loved work came to public attention or helped save the lives of tens of thousands of children. Historian Amanda Vickery and Radio 3 presenter Tom Service present this docu-drama that recreates the performance of Messiah at London's Foundling Hospital in 1750 and reveals how this special fundraising concert helped maintain the institution and heralded a golden age of philanthropy.(n)

programme.title: Darcey Bussell's Looking for Audrey
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge and former Royal Ballet star Darcey Bussell has admired the work of Hollywood actress Audrey Hepburn for decades, impressed by a few striking parallels between them - their love of dance, the ability to reinvent themselves and a strong belief that family comes first. Now Darcey takes the opportunity to explore the actress's private world, discovering how she survived starvation during the Nazi occupation of Holland, and went on to win respect and admiration for her work in the theatre and movies as well as for her humanitarian deeds.(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare's Mother: The Secret Life of a Tudor Woman
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Michael Wood charts the story of Mary Arden, the mother of William Shakespeare. Born during the reign of Henry VIII, she was the daughter of a Warwickshire farmer, and found herself part of the burgeoning middle class in Stratford-upon-Avon following her marriage to wool and hide dealer John Shakespeare. Together, they had eight children - three of whom died young - and her husband went on to become mayor before he was declared bankrupt, and they faced financial ruin, religious persecution and power politics - until they were rescued by their eldest son William.(n)

programme.title: The Killer Wave of 1607: Timewatch
programme.desc: Geologist Simon Haslett and tsunami expert Ted Bryant reveal the devastation caused to Britain when a 12m-high wall of water hit an area near Bristol in 1607 and claimed 2,000 lives. It crashed ashore with such ferocity that the geography of the coastline was altered for ever, yet despite being chronicled by eyewitnesses, the country's worst natural disaster has been forgotten with time.(n)

programme.title: The Mystery of Rome's X Tomb
programme.desc: A mass grave containing more than 2,000 skeletons was found in one of Rome's catacombs following a roof collapse in an area marked with an X in the Vatican's underground mapping system. In this documentary, historian Michael Scott joins experts called in by to identify who the dead were and what killed them.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Maths
programme.desc: Marcus du Sautoy examines the mathematics of geometry central to the 17th-century work of Descartes and Newton and the understanding of how objects move. This led to the development of calculus and modular arithmetic, still at the heart of mathematics to this day, as well as Fermat's Last Theorem, which has puzzled mathematicians for more than 350 years.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.desc: Melbourne and Fremantle lock horns in round four of the Australian Football League at the MCG. The hosts have taken more marks than any other side so far in 2017, averaging 118.7.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Reload
programme.desc: The best bits from BT Sport over the last week, including the pick of the goals from across Europe. Plus, action from the Aviva Premiership, Fight Night Boxing, MotoGP and UFC 210.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Preview
programme.desc: A look ahead to this weekend's Premier League fixtures, including Manchester United v Chelsea, Southampton v Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur v Bournemouth.(n)

programme.title: Scottish Football Extra
programme.desc: Darrell Currie is joined by Gary Locke, Michael Stewart, Stephen Craigan and Chris Sutton at Rugby Park to discuss the hot topics in Scottish football.(n)

programme.title: Scottish Professional Football League
programme.desc: Kilmarnock host Hearts in the Ladbrokes Premiership at Rugby Park. The visitors need three points here as they look to keep alive their hopes of claiming a Europa League berth.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Preview
programme.desc: A look ahead to this weekend's Premier League fixtures, including Manchester United v Chelsea, Southampton v Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur v Bournemouth.(n)

programme.title: Total Italian Football
programme.desc: A look ahead to this weekend's Serie A fixtures, including Inter Milan v AC Milan, Pescara v Juventus and Napoli v Udinese.(n)

programme.title: Live Serie A
programme.desc: Inter and AC Milan lock horns at the San Siro in one of the biggest derbies in world football. With both sides aiming for Europe, this key clash takes on even greater significance.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Highlights
programme.desc: A round-up of Tuesday's UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg ties as Juventus hosted Barcelona and Borussia Dortmund took on Monaco.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Highlights
programme.desc: A round-up of Wednesday's UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg ties as Leicester travelled to Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich hosted Real Madrid and Dortmund faced Monaco.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Score
programme.desc: Mark Pougatch is joined by Jermaine Jenas, Chris Sutton, Paul Ince, Alex Scott and David James to bring you all the latest scores as they come in. Join in using £BTSportScore.(n)

programme.title: Live Premier League

programme.desc: Pat asks Robert to keep her cigarette habit a secret - but he later has to come up with an excuse when Amy smells smoke on him, leading to a string of revelations for the family.(n)

programme.desc: The shrink bumps into a former friend of Martin's while visiting Maris in hospital. The pair parted on bad terms, so Frasier tries to effect a reconciliation. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge sets out to halt the plans of an unscrupulous businessman intending to defraud Springfield's residents by supplying them with a defective monorail system. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma decides to take her Aunt Gladys's advice and start a family - but a day in charge of Bart and Lisa at a beer-themed amusement park soon changes her mind.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart grows frustrated by Homer's lack of interest in him and sets out to search for a new father figure. Lisa tries to break her addiction to an expensive teenage chat-line, but finds it harder than expected.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Food

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Bahrain Grand Prix Practice 3 Live: 2017.
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie presents coverage from the third round of the season at the Bahrain International Circuit in Sakhir, as the drivers conclude their preparations ahead of the qualifying session.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie interviews the veteran Formula 1 commentator, who discusses his Army service in the Second World War, his day-job in advertising, and his true passion - motor sports.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Bahrain Grand Prix Qualifying Live.
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents from the Bahrain International Circuit in Sakhir, as the third round of the season continues. Then-world champion Lewis Hamilton claimed pole position for Mercedes here in 2016, ahead of team-mate Nico Rosberg and Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel in third. The Brit would go on to finish the race in third, however, with the other Ferrari of Kimi Raikkonen finishing in second place and Rosberg claiming top spot.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedy actor Jack Dee embark on a clock-conscious exploration of the Italian city, enjoying two days rich in humour, history, culture and pizza. The pair start with a guided tour on vintage Vespas amid the city's chaotic traffic, attend a pizza-making class and then head to the volcanic ruins of Herculaneum. Day two sees them visit the Isle of Capri and play the lottery using la smorfia, a local guide to the meaning of dreams.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Book Thief
programme.desc: Premiere. A girl separated from her family is raised by foster parents in Nazi Germany, who instill in her a love of reading. She is horrified by the book burnings and tries to save volumes from the flames, while she and her adoptive family provide a safe hiding place for a Jewish boy. Drama based on Markus Zusak's novel, starring Sophie Nelisse, Geoffrey Rush and Emily Watson.(n)

programme.title: The Imitation Game
programme.desc: Biopic of mathematician Alan Turing, whose work during the Second World War translated seemingly unbreakable Nazi codes as well as pioneering the development of computer technology. In the years following the war, his life would be destroyed as his homosexuality was discovered, leaving him facing criminal charges. Starring Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley and Charles Dance.(n)

programme.title: Solomon Kane
programme.desc: A 17th-century mercenary renounces violence after an encounter with a demon convinces him he is going to Hell. However, when a girl is captured by an evil sorcerer, he takes up arms once more, using his fighting skills to slay the forces of evil and redeem himself for his past sins. Period fantasy thriller, starring James Purefoy, Max Von Sydow and Pete Postlethwaite.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Liam's fury with Grace grows and he has a plan for those closest to her, Lynette hands Scott some devastating news, and Cleo gets jealous over Joel. Meanwhile, Nancy bumps into her first boyfriend Kyle at an MS meeting.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits Reigate in Surrey, where retired couple Lenny and Mary are struggling to secure a sale on their home. He discovers dated decor and pine cladding are creating a problem for the pair, who want to sell up as soon as possible and return to their Irish roots.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Vale of Berkeley Guest House in Gloucestershire, where owners Harri and Claire Chiba hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, two guests from rival B&Bs have an issue with the no-frills toilet, and another places a tricky request for `anaemic toast' at the breakfast table.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in west London with two couples moving to the city. Professional rugby player Alex and teacher Sarah are relocating for work from Penarth near Cardiff, and are in for a shock when they realise the speed of the London property market. In Kensington and Chelsea, Marion and Fraser are seeking a one-bedroom flat on a budget of £475,000.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug starts to get lonely when Carrie has to work nights, but soon discovers that Arthur is the ideal person to keep him company. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Jerry Stiller.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie fail to make a good impression on a professional couple who move in next door, while Arthur takes advantage of Spencer's job. With Leah Remini and Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra sees newlywed friends making a public display of affection, and cannot help wondering why Raymond has so much trouble telling her he loves her. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: Hop

Part-animated comedy, starring James Marsden, with the voice of Russell Brand.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Wild
programme.sub-title: Kevin McCloud's Escape to the Wild.
programme.desc: Kevin travels to Central America to meet British family-of-five the Atkinsons, who have quit London to live a simpler existence in the rainforests of Belize. As he attempts to understand their motivations for the move, he suffers from the heat, is attacked by swarms of biting insects and shares his mud hut with a large scorpion, but begins to appreciate the rewards of a simple jungle life, one in which they've constructed a two-storey building entirely from recycled rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Rome's Sunken Secrets
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the underwater ruins of Baiae, an ancient Roman city located in the modern-day Bay of Naples, which in its time was an exclusive retreat for the wealthiest and most influential of the empire's citizens. A team of historians and volcanologists examine the relics that have been uncovered from the city and investigate the reasons why it sank. Baiae was located in a volcanic landscape, which provided a supply of hot water and steaming sulphur baths - but also led to the city's destruction.(n)

programme.title: Homeland

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on three couples living on benefits. They include Karen and Paul who once ran a launderette, but after losing their business they now struggle to get by on benefits. Yvonne and David are getting married and planning to make it the best day ever - despite only being paid in a year the same amount as the cost of the average UK wedding.
