programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary meets claimants living on the breadline in Yorkshire. They include 45-year-old Alex, who dreams of making it as a DJ and has just blown thousands of pounds on record decks, and Geordie couple Michelle and Thomas, who are now living in Leeds, where they are pushing for their children to have a better future. Plus, a Whitby man who says the sickness benefit he receives is only enough to feed his partner and baby daughter five days out of every seven.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People coping with medical conditions on top of their financial difficulties, featuring a family of four from Whitby who include a father with Tourette's and an autistic son. In Doncaster, a woman with cerebral palsy needs round-the-clock care, but that does not stop her campaigning for animal rights, while in Barnsley, a hoarder with a flat full of clutter has been deemed fit to work despite her arthritis - and now she has the bailiffs chasing her.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Claire and Simon seek eviction specialist Chris's help to evict a man claiming to be renting their old family home. Meanwhile, Hamza hopes to get his council flat back after he tried to help a neighbour's friend by letting them stay for a week, but ended up being shut out when they refused to leave. Plus, a man is almost £30k in debt and in danger of repossession after his tenants stopped paying the rent.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court Enforcement Agents Paul and Steve are sent to north London to evict a young Romanian mother who owes £6,000 in unpaid rent, but when they arrive, they discover a family home that is not quite what it appears to be. Meanwhile, in Kent, Brian and Alan turn up the pressure on a debtor who has admitted to owing more than £7,000, but claims he cannot afford to pay up - despite having a garage full of expensive tools. Later, in south-west London, Brian accompanies Delroy as he tries to recover a £400,000 debt from a residential property, and when the pair trace the defaulter to an upmarket cafe, the man in charge lies about his identity.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents have an explosive run-in with a debtor as they try to retrieve £1,800 owed by a car dealership, and in Derbyshire, two officers try to collect more than £1,500 in unpaid parking fines. Elsewhere, Max and Paul are in London as they attempt to recover £2,000 owed by a property company, but an employee refuses to let them enter.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kensi goes in search of her father's killer, before bumping into her mother, who she has not seen for more than 15 years. Meanwhile, the discovery that a member of Kensi's father's unit faked his own death prompts Granger to back down from his suspicions of his colleague. Crime drama, starring Daniela Ruah and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team looks into a raid on a naval base, and Dr Cyril Taft - the surgeon who saved Gibbs' life - experiences the thrill of assisting on an investigation. Assigned to treat Gibbs' suspect, Taft manages to uncover evidence that may prove crucial to solving the case. Meanwhile, DiNozzo pays his old flame Jeanne Benoit a visit as he chases a lead involving doctors in Sudan. Guest starring John Cryer and Scottie Thompson.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: A look back at the noughties, which witnessed the birth of reality TV and some bizarre scenes caught on camera - from George Galloway's turn as a cat in Celebrity Big Brother, to Katie Price and Peter Andre's love affair and Gillian McKeith's fit of the vapours on I'm a Celebrity. It was also the decade that saw Susan Boyle shock the judges on Britain's Got Talent, Miley Cyrus cause a storm at the VMAs, Robbie Williams rejoin Take That, and Kate Moss dabble with cocaine. There are also reflections on incidents involving Tiger Woods, Lance Armstrong and Wayne Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Knock Off
programme.desc: A fashion designer hoping to put his shady past behind him learns his business associate is an undercover CIA agent. As the unlikely duo investigate a trade in fake fashion, they discover a plot by Russian mobsters to sell microscopic bombs to terrorists. Action thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Rob Schneider and Lela Rochon.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice tackles a Grade II-listed building in Frome, Somerset.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant meets a fox cub, a deer is released into the wild, and the vets have their hands full caring for a badger tangled in barbed wire.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Aaron doesn't want his dad to join him on a school trip, so Angel Rafe intervenes.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.sub-title: It's Go Go Go at Silver Hatch.
programme.desc: A commentator is invited to report on a stunt display by the cars, but has other ideas, and confesses he has always dreamed of racing himself. Guest starring Murray Walker.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: The friends let Pasty fly their kite, but he is too small to hold it down and it ends up carrying him out to sea.(n)

programme.title: Mr Men
programme.desc: The people of Dillydale carry on even though it is raining.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: New series. Pre-school animation about a rabbit learning about emotions. Mogu worries that a crow will eat all the cherries on the tree, so Kerry builds a scarecrow.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa help Daddy Pig look for his glasses.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups and the Trouble with Turtles.
programme.desc: Lots of baby turtles cause chaos when they appear all over town. Ryder and the pups must gather them up and take them back to their pond.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: A slip-up from Roley leaves the band's instruments out of action, leaving Bob to conjure up alternatives from whatever he can find in the yard.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Nipper accidentally dislodges a train's brake and sends the crowded and driverless locomotive careering across the mountains.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Stan enters a golf tournament against a competitive businessman, but Olly is on hand to help him avoid getting too nervous.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The heroine tries to win a fancy-dress competition at the castle.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder surprises the new pups with a new mobile lookout vehicle and Jake is rescued from an Arctic storm by a brave mountain ranger pup named Everest.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Herds of dinosaurs have a parade through Axle City, but Blaze, AJ and Zeg have to find them all after Crusher splits up the procession.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Little Lost Toy.
programme.desc: When a little clockwork duck turns up at the DinoLab, Noddy tries to find out where it comes from and return it to its family.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Animated series. Two twin genies-in-training live in a pendant necklace worn by their human best friend and come to her aid whenever she needs help.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Extended special in which Peppa and her family go on a world tour in Miss Rabbit's plane, visiting the jungle, the desert and the South Pole.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf try to stop the gnomes from eating tulips, daffodils and hedgehogs as spring arrives.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team must overcome impossible odds to acquire the final Black Hole Generator piece.(n)

programme.title: Funniest Fails, Falls & Flops
programme.desc: Comedy clip show featuring pranks gone wrong, unwise acts and failed attempts of misplaced ambition.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Grannies Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Internet videos featuring pensioners doing bizarre and humorous things, including a couple who became unwitting online stars when their inability to work their webcam went viral. Plus, a grandmother's heavy metal vocals that caught the attention of Black Sabbath's Ozzy Osbourne, and an Australian whose bad attitude has turned her into an unlikely online sensation at the age of 78.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Playful Pups Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring puppies doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: Watership Down
programme.desc: Young rabbits go in search of a safe place to live after one of them envisions the destruction of their warren. But their cross-country journey is fraught with danger, as they encounter predators and a brutal rival colony. Animated drama based on the novel by Richard Adams, with the voices of John Hurt, Richard Briers, Marcus Graham-Cox, Denholm Elliott, Michael Hordern and Zero Mostel.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Animated Movies
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay presents a countdown of some of the greatest cartoon films ever made, from classic animation to modern computer-generated movies. Featuring a look at the difficult early days of Walt Disney's movie empire, an introduction to some of the actors behind popular characters' voices, and comments from celebrity fans.(n)

programme.title: Oliver
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Naughty Cats Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring cats doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Prince Story: Icon, Genius, Slave
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the singer's troubled private life, exploring the emotional turmoil that inspired some of his most famous songs. The programme examines some of the more unusual incidents in his career, including his failed marriage and changing his name to a symbol, as well as the circumstances that led him to die alone.(n)

programme.title: Purple Rain
programme.desc: A talented singer tries to escape his troubled home life through his music. However, his arrogant nature puts him in danger of alienating his band and losing the fellow performer he loves to a charismatic rival. Musical drama, starring Prince, Apollonia Kotero, Morris Day and Olga Karlatos. The soundtrack features hits including the title track, Let's Go Crazy and the Oscar-winning When Doves Cry.(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Maverick cop Harry Callahan investigates a series of brutal murders linked to a macabre gambling game that involves predicting celebrities' deaths(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's scorching drama of a young dealer seduced by money and power, who hooks up with a high-powered company trader. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for his performance as stockbroking devil Gordon Gekko(n)

programme.title: Life or Something like It
programme.desc: Jolie is the reporter who interviews a psychic for a jokey piece about a sports result. When he tells her she has just seven days to live, she starts to rethink her high-flying job and relationship with a baseball star. Romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Painfully shy Todd Anderson has been sent to the school where his popular older brother was valedictorian. His room-mate, Neil, although exceedingly bright and popular, is very much under the thumb of his overbearing father. The two, along with their other friends, meet Professor Keating who tells them of the Dead Poets Society, and encourages them to go against the status quo. Each, in his own way, does this, and is changed for life(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: William Peter Blatty's Oscar-winning adaptation of his bestseller about a child (Linda Blair) possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Based on a true event, the film follows the 2010 mining disaster incident where a group of thirty-three miners were trapped inside the San Jose mine in Chile for more than two months after a gold and copper mine collapses(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home in this nostalgic and moving romance(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: An orphan boy discovers his destiny as Peter Pan, and is whisked away to an enchanted land to battle the fearsome pirate Blackbeard with the help of the warrior woman Tiger Lily(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: An elite cop protects a witness from a murderous cult(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: NaÏve Texan Joe Buck drifts to New York and, with the help of local wheeler-dealer Enrico 'Ratso' Rizzo, tries to make a living as a gigolo(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: A genetic mutation causes mild-mannered Bruce Banner to turn into the green and muscular Incredible Hulk when he gets angry. While he searches for a cure, the military attempt to create their own genetically modified equivalent using one of their soldiers(n)

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins(n)

programme.title: Dave Chappelle's Block Party
programme.desc: Comedian Dave Chappelle hosts a rib-tickling, foot-stomping, booty-shaking celebration in Brooklyn's Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood and supplies the musical star power, including Kanye West and the Fugees' first performance together in seven years. Also featured: Mos Def, the Roots, Jill Scott, Erykah Badu, Common, Dead Prez, Andre 4000 and Cody Chestnutt. Directed by Michel Gondry(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Joel Schumacher's psychological thriller with Colin Farrell trapped in a phone booth and targeted by a sniper(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: A cop, out to avenge the murder of his family, sees the investigation take a supernatural turn for the worse(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Dynamic Samuel L. Jackson stars as New York City cop John Shaft, who quits the force and decides to dispense his own brand of vigilante justice against a racist killer (Christian Bale) and a Dominican drug lord (Jeffrey Wright). Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three '70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jackson's uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy in this taut crime thriller(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: The Beast With a Billion Backs
programme.desc: The Beast With a Billion Backs. The creator of The Simpsons, Matt Groening, is responsible for this animated series. Set in the year 3000, the series follows Fry (voiced by Billy West), a 25- year-old New York pizza delivery boy who, after being accidentally cryogenically frozen, wakes up to a whole new world. The future he discovers has airborne freeways, rocket ships, talking heads in jars, dangerously addictive soft drinks and Stop 'n' Drop suicide booths. Fortunately he has on hand his friends Bender (voiced by John DiMaggio), a hard-drinking, cigar-smoking, pornography-reading robot, and Leela (voiced by Katey Sagal), a beautiful, one-eyed alien martial arts expert, to help him make sense of this new environment(n)

programme.title: Big Daddy
programme.desc: Prospective parents everywhere, meet the world's least likely paternal role model: Adam Sandler! In Big Daddy, Sandler plays 30-year-old bachelor Sonny Koufax, a carefree slob who has never much taken to adult responsibilities; he works one day a week as a tollbooth collector, and spends the remainder of his time living off of a $200,000 reward he collected from an auto accident. All told, the life suits him just fine. However, as his old buddies start getting married and drifting away, Sonny realizes that if he doesn't do something soon, he could end up all alone for the rest of his life. When his most recent girlfriend, Vanessa (Kristy Swanson), indicates that she needs some time off because she's sick of being with a man who can't act like a grown-up, he decides that it's time to take drastic action to win her back. Conveniently enough, a little boy named Julian (Cole Sprouse and Dylan Sprouse) turns up on his doorstep, claiming that he's the biological son of Sonny's roommate and friend from law school, Kevin (Jon Stewart). The kid tells Sonny that he's from Buffalo, New York; Kevin has never been to Buffalo, New York, but no matter - Sonny foresees, in Julian, an opportunity to convince Vanessa that he can face adult responsibilities. He thus takes charge of the little boy over a long Columbus Day weekend, pretending to be Kevin. However, the plan doesn't work as expected, and the authorities hone in on a discovery of Sonny's real identity. Meanwhile, Sonny finds himself genuinely drawn to the tyke. Also supporting Sandler in Big Daddy are Joey Lauren Adams, Josh Mostel and Rob Schneider(n)

programme.title: Weapons of War
programme.desc: The Stuka dive-bomber, which had a huge impact on the course of the Second World War. Experts analyse its deceptive image as a cumbersome, obsolete piece of weaponry.(n)

programme.title: Weapons of War
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the evolution of the German Panzers, a fleet of lightly armoured tanks that spearheaded the Nazi blitzkrieg and changed the concept of warfare.(n)

programme.title: Time to Remember
programme.desc: Archive newsreel coverage and voiceovers are used to tell the story of the media attention that surrounded notorious gangsters and other Depression-era criminals in America. Including footage of smugglers trying to outrun the US Coastguard and beat Prohibition, mobster Jack `Legs' Diamond, the imprisonment of John Dillinger, and Al Capone at the racecourse. The programme also includes courtroom recordings from the trial of Bruno Richard Hauptmann for the murder of Charles and Anne Lindbergh's baby. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Time to Remember
programme.desc: Archive footage telling war stories from the home front. Featuring coverage of circus elephants being used as farm animals during the First World War, a pram that offered protection against a gas attack, Londoners' use of the Underground in the Second World War, and the celebrations to mark the end of both global conflicts. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Battle Castle with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the history of Malbork Castle in Poland, a stronghold of the Teutonic knights during the Baltic Crusades, and a place where they found refuge from enemies.(n)

programme.title: Biblical Conspiracies
programme.desc: Tracking a five-year scientific investigation into the provenance and function of two Roman nails discovered in the tomb of the Jerusalem High Priest Caiaphas.(n)

programme.title: Biblical Conspiracies
programme.desc: Following an investigation into one of Michelangelo's early clay models that was destined to become the most venerated Christian sculpture in history.(n)

programme.title: Jesus: Man Behind the Myths

programme.title: Time to Remember
programme.desc: Archive newsreel coverage and voiceovers are used to tell the story of the media attention that surrounded notorious gangsters and other Depression-era criminals in America. The programme also includes courtroom recordings from the trial of Bruno Richard Hauptmann for the murder of Charles and Anne Lindbergh's baby. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: It's Christmas time in Poplar and love is in the air as Jenny's relationship with Alec continues to blossom, while Shelagh is planning her quiet wedding to Dr Turner. However, the peace is suddenly disturbed when the police arrive at Nonnatus House to announce an unexploded bomb has been discovered just around the corner and everybody in the district is being evacuated to safety. The electricity has been cut off and the streets are pitch-black, and with the locals scurrying to safety, the nuns and nurses reach out to anyone in need of medical help. The spirit of the Blitz takes over as the community's members pull together - aware that, at any moment, their homes could be reduced to rubble. Jessica Raine, Jenny Agutter, Pam Ferris and Laura Main star in a festive special of the 1950s-set drama, with a guest appearance by comedian Sandi Toksvig.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Miss Elizabeth Mapp reigns supreme in the picturesque town of Tilling, and has even more reason to gloat than usual when she lets her house for the summer to a very desirable tenant - Mrs Emmeline Lucas, known to her friends as Lucia. However, when the newcomer proves more popular with the locals than expected, Mapp is left out in the cold, leading to a constant battle for supremacy over bridge parties, garden fetes, art competitions and even the odd yoga class. Period comedy, starring Miranda Richardson and Anna Chancellor. Written by co-star Steve Pemberton, based on the comic novels by EF Benson.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies stars in a feature-length episode of the offbeat crime drama. Master of illusion Jonathan is called upon to solve several disappearances inside the gloomy attic of a vast Gothic house, but is completely baffled by the mystery, which for 70 years has been attributed to the ghost of a madman said to prey upon human flesh. When two women shelter from a thunderstorm there one night, the ominous presence claims another victim, leaving her friend - Joey Ross - determined to get to the truth of what happened. Jonathan finds himself working alongside Joey, and it seems his formidable powers of deduction are in danger of being eclipsed by her raw intuition. With Sheridan Smith as Joey.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Quirky crime drama. A housekeeper's assistant working for a celebrated crime writer becomes convinced she is losing her mind following a series of bizarre occurrences in his house. As master of illusion Jonathan and his intrepid sidekick Joey Ross puzzle over the strange events, they realise the mysterious death of a former resident in 1889, who apparently fell victim to the supernatural powers of his Egyptian employee, could hold the key. Starring Alan Davies, Sheridan Smith and guests Natalie Walter, Paul McGann, Sasha Behar and Ian McNeice.(n)

programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Mapp is still reeling from Lucia's victory at the summer fete and is left to watch disconsolately as the locals flock to her rival's little dinner parties across the street. Before long, however, she sees her chance for revenge. As the townsfolk busy themselves preparing their entries for the summer art exhibition, one of the highlights of the social calendar, Lucia and Georgie lay out their intentions to submit their sketches - giving Mapp a rather wicked idea to keep them out altogether. But it turns out that subterfuge rarely likes being hidden for long in a place like Tilling. Period comedy, starring Miranda Richardson, Anna Chancellor and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Clue of the Savant's Thumb.
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the quirky crime drama. A dead body impossibly vanishes from a locked study - giving self-styled paranormal investigator Joey Ross a fresh mystery to solve. She could do with some help from her old sidekick, the master of illusion Jonathan Creek - but he has moved on and shows little interest in the case. As Joey starts digging she meets the investigating officer - Gideon Pryke, a sharp-minded DI who remembers Creek from one of his previous cases. But he's not quite the man he used to be. programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.(n)

programme.desc: A look at some of the world's strongest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Wildlife series examining the challenges predators face as they stalk their prey, and revealing how it is far more common for hunts to end in failure. The first episode demonstrates how leopards use stealth and concealment to get close to their prey, while African wild dogs have to work as a team. The programme also features footage of killer whales, which rely on their intelligence, Nile crocodiles that can wait years between meals, spiders able to spin 25 foot webs and amur falcons, which travel 16,000 miles every year to hunt insects. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.sub-title: In the Grip of the Seasons.
programme.desc: Cameras follow predators living in the Arctic, who face a particularly challenging search for food, as the environment around them constantly changes with the seasons, from a continent of ice in perpetual darkness to a scattering of islands in constant sunshine. A polar bear climbs to reach a birds' nest, while another makes holes in the ice to catch seals. Plus, a look at how Arctic foxes have adapted to catch auks in mid-flight and the hunting strategies of Arctic wolves. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The challenges predators face finding and catching prey in a forest, where more than half the animal species on Earth live. However, it proves a tricky environment for predators, as vision is often blocked, escape routes are numerous, and the terrain makes travelling at speed almost impossible. The programme features footage of tigers using their surroundings to ambush deer and pine martens making tunnels in the snow, as well as examining the strategies adopted by sparrowhawks, jumping spiders, tarsiers, eagles and chimpanzees.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining the hunting methods of aquatic predators. The vastness of oceans means that wildlife is scattered over a large area, and animals often have to travel great distances in search of food. Blue whales' great size proves useful in their search for krill, while frigate birds have developed a clever means of catching food without having to land on water. Also featuring footage of sharks, sea lions, spinner dolphins, albatross and sargassum fish.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: A look at how predators hunt on the coast, both in the water and on land. The environment is in a constant state of change as the tides ebb and flow, so any opportunities to feed must be taken quickly. The programme features footage of dolphins, octopuses, monkeys, fishing wolves and one of the world's largest ever gatherings of humpback whales.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The wildlife series concludes by examining efforts by scientists to ensure the survival of endangered species of carnivores, as the spread of human habitation impacts on the wildest areas of the planet and jeopardises the predators' opportunities to hunt and thrive. The film uses natural history footage to examine the current situation across five continents, revealing the precarious future faced by many of the world's most fascinating species, including lions, tigers, polar bears and blue whales.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Wildlife series examining the challenges predators face as they stalk their prey, and revealing how it is far more common for hunts to end in failure. The first episode demonstrates how leopards use stealth and concealment to get close to their prey, while African wild dogs have to work as a team. The programme also features footage of killer whales, which rely on their intelligence, Nile crocodiles that can wait years between meals, spiders able to spin 25 foot webs and amur falcons, which travel 16,000 miles every year to hunt insects. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.sub-title: In the Grip of the Seasons.
programme.desc: Cameras follow predators living in the Arctic, who face a particularly challenging search for food, as the environment around them constantly changes with the seasons, from a continent of ice in perpetual darkness to a scattering of islands in constant sunshine. A polar bear climbs to reach a birds' nest, while another makes holes in the ice to catch seals. Plus, a look at how Arctic foxes have adapted to catch auks in mid-flight and the hunting strategies of Arctic wolves. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The challenges predators face finding and catching prey in a forest, where more than half the animal species on Earth live. However, it proves a tricky environment for predators, as vision is often blocked, escape routes are numerous, and the terrain makes travelling at speed almost impossible. The programme features footage of tigers using their surroundings to ambush deer and pine martens making tunnels in the snow, as well as examining the strategies adopted by sparrowhawks, jumping spiders, tarsiers, eagles and chimpanzees.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining the hunting methods of aquatic predators. The vastness of oceans means that wildlife is scattered over a large area, and animals often have to travel great distances in search of food. Blue whales' great size proves useful in their search for krill, while frigate birds have developed a clever means of catching food without having to land on water. Also featuring footage of sharks, sea lions, spinner dolphins, albatross and sargassum fish.(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: In Love With the King. Historical drama about three women manoeuvring to become queen of England begins in 1463, as a secret wedding between a commoner and a royal leads to some regal intrigue(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Price of Power. After Elizabeth's coronation, an extravagant display designed to silence critics of their marriage, Edward needs a son to secure his reign. But tensions at court escalate into outright war and Edward must fight those closest to him to retain his crown. Elizabeth faces devastating loss as the full force of Warwick's hatred is revealed(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Storm. Desperate to further her son's claim to the throne, Margaret Beaufort joins Warwick's rebellion against Edward. The rebellion fails and the traitors must run for their lives. Jasper Tudor escapes into exile, while Warwick and George sail for France. Elizabeth and Jacquetta turn to witchcraft to stop them, but it is Isabel who is punished(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Bad Queen. Exiled in France, Warwick still plots to control the crown. His youngest daughter Anne is used to make an unexpected alliance, giving him command of a huge army. When Warwick lands in England, Edward must decide whether to fight or run. Terrified, Elizabeth escapes to sanctuary, not knowing if her husband is alive or dead. She gives birth to a longed-for son, but is in fear for her life as Warwick enters London(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: War at First Hand. After witnessing the brutality of the battlefield, Queen Elizabeth, Anne Neville and Margaret Beaufort see their relationships turn even more bitter(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: Love and Death. The crown is secure, but there is no peace at court. Elizabeth suffers more emotional turmoil as she loses those closest to her. Margaret Beaufort plans a political marriage to bring Henry home from exile - but has she met her match in Lord Stanley? Anne's marriage made her a traitor, so she is handed into George's care. His motives for keeping her away from court are questioned by Richard, who fears for Anne's safety(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: Poison and Malmsey Wine. George's anger at losing the Warwick inheritance and his failure to capture the crown resurfaces, with horrific consequences. As the court divides, George openly accuses Elizabeth of witchcraft and Edward of murder. This is treason, and Edward must condemn his own brother to death. Elizabeth finally has revenge on those who killed her father, but it does not bring her comfort(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: Long Live the King. After years of peace an untimely death once again engulfs Elizabeth in a fight for the throne. Trapped in sanctuary and threatened by those closest to her, Elizabeth is forced into an alliance with Margaret Beaufort. Suspicion and doubt poison the court, turning friends into enemies and family into murderers(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Princess in the Tower. Margaret and Queen Elizabeth scheme against each other(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Final Battle. A new generation of power-seekers emerges in the Season 1 finale(n)

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: Movie version of the hit sci-fi series about two FBI agents who investigate cases which defy rational explanation. The agents are closer than they have ever been to proving the existence of extraterrestrial life, but there are forces out there desperate to stop them. The duo travel from the desert of Texas to a remote outpost in the frozen wilderness before they discover the truth(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: A rogue pilot and his best friend team with a princess to help her save her planet when an evil space commander wants to steal all the planet's air in this "Star Wars" spoof(n)

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects
programme.desc: Three psychopathic family members go on a killing spree as a vengeful sheriff tracks their trail in this gory sequel to House of 1000 Corpses(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: On The Trail. Part 2 of four. A deadly pursuit on the plains pits Gus (Robert Duvall) against a sadistic renegade named Blue Duck (Frederic Forrest). Call: Tommy Lee Jones. Jake: Robert Urich. Lorena: Diane Lane. Deets: Danny Glover. July Johnson: Chris Cooper(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: The Plains. Part 3 of four. Off the trail, Jake (Robert Urich) falls in with bad company, while Gus (Robert Duvall) shares a bittersweet reunion with an old flame (Anjelica Huston). Call: Tommy Lee Jones. Lorena: Diane Lane. Newt: Ricky Schroder. Deets: Danny Glover. Suggs: Dan O'Herlihy. Elmira: Glenne Headly(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Return. The Outfit is shocked by their recent loss but continue into buffalo territory, where Gus is surrounded by hostile Indians and wounded(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Anarchy. In 12th-century England, a power struggle ensues between the late king's only legitimate daughter and his nephew, who has ascended the throne via a mysterious technicality. Against this backdrop, a man of God endeavors to build a glorious cathedral(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Master Builder. Ian McShane, Rufus Sewell, Hayley Atwell and Donald Sutherland star in this adaptation of Ken Follett's best-selling novel, a love story set against a backdrop of war, religious strife and power struggles in 12th-century England. Aliena's father the Earl is executed for supporting Maud. To prove her family's loyalty to King Stephen, she vows to fund her brother Richard's knighthood so that he can fight against Maud. William and his mother Regan plot with Waleran to have the cathedral project transferred to Shiring - which is now in their possession. Despite their interference, Tom and Prior Philip continue work on the cathedral. Waleran arranges a visit by the King, intending to sabotage the project once and for all, but Jack's newly-carved statue of the cathedral's patron saint has an unexpected and shocking effect on the King, who is plagued by madness and religious visions(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Redemption. Prior Philip and William are both stonewalled in their attempts to access the Shiring quarry; Jack discovers hidden artistic talents as he attempts to carve a religious statue; Richard receives monetary help from Aliena in his quest to become a knight. Meanwhile, King Stephen collapses on a visit to the cathedral worksite(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Battlefield. After William applies to have his father's title of earl transferred to him, he learns that a knight is also interested in the noble ranking. Elsewhere, Jack's reappearance causes a frightened King Stephen to order his assassination; hostages are taken from each side in the ongoing hostilities between the king and Maud; Waleran informs Maud that Philip is responsible for betraying Earl Bartholomew(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Legacy. Waleran and Regan work toward a prisoner exchange in hopes of remaining on the victorious side of the war; Tom wants Alfred and Jack to become friends, but their work and love lives get in the way. Meanwhile, William's plan to thwart Aliena involves attacking Kingsbridge; Prior Philip and the Hamleighs receive rights to Shiring lands, but it comes with a steep price(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: Witchcraft. Upon returning from the war, Richard learns Aliena has no money to continue to finance his knighthood; Alfred requests that Prior Philip accept him as a master builder for the construction of the cathedral; Regan leans on Waleran to approach the king about William's long-overdue earldom; and Aliena is torn between her love for Jack and a promise she made to her late father(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: New Beginnings. Jack's journeys lead to a discovery of how to make Tom Builder's vision of a light-filled cathedral a reality; the Hamleighs are infuriated that Kingsbridge has once again become a successful and prosperous market center, and they plan to do something about it(n)

programme.title: The Pillars of the Earth
programme.desc: The Work of Angels. In the series finale, Waleran and Alfred scheme to get rid of Jack, but it may not prove as easy as they thought(n)

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Hit comedy about a couple who are called away from home unexpectedly and reluctantly choose Uncle Buck to look after their children for three weeks - with hilarious results!(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A pair of mismatched government operatives set out to recover stolen nuclear warheads from international terrorists. When missiles being transported on a Russian train are supposedly destroyed, a brash army specialist is teamed with an ambitious female executive. They soon learn a grudging respect as the hunt for the weapons takes them across Europe and culminates in a tense Manhattan showdown(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dawn

Christian Bale, Steve Zahn, Jeremy Davies, Teerawat Mulvilai, Pat Healy(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers

programme.title: Dead Heist
programme.desc: Hip-hop horror with a host of music stars. Four friends plan the perfect bank job, but while they're clearing the tills, vampiric zombies are clearing the streets and now the gang are trapped(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dawn
programme.desc: Acclaimed filmmaker Werner Herzog wrote and directed this stirring tale based on the true story of a U.S. Navy fighter pilot's struggle of survival after being shot down and captured during a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War. Christian Bale, Steve Zahn, Jeremy Davies, Teerawat Mulvilai, Pat Healy(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: New York City, 1863. Before there was the city we know today, a city of wealth, power and infinite dreams, New York was a very different place, a fledgling young city where the desire for a better life raged in crime-ridden streets. Here, as the Nations own survival was being tested by the ongoing Civil War, a vast and dangerous underworld was born in the streets. These were the gangs of New York, as portrayed in Herbert Asburys classic book, whose racketeering, bootlegging, swindling, gambling and murdering would become legendary - and whose culture of corruption threatened the very survival of Americas working people. In the young, unfinished City, it was a time of ruthlessness, intolerance and fear. But it was also a time of extraordinary bravery, as those pushed to the edge fought for the freedom of future generations. Director Martin Scorsese sets this epic drama in this defining moment in New York City history, an era whose conflicts helped define who and what makes an American. Against the backdrop of this brave new world unfolds a story about a fatherless sons search for honor, vengeance and the courage to remake his life(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: In 1943 North Africa, George Patton (George C. Scott) assumes command of (and instills some much-needed discipline in) the American forces. Engaged in battle against Germany's Field Marshal Rommel (Karl Michael Vogler), Patton drives back "The Desert Fox" by using the German's own tactics. Promoted to Lieutenant General, Patton is sent to Sicily, where he engages in a personal war of egos with British Field Marshal Montgomery (Michael Bates). Performing brilliantly in Italy, Patton seriously jeopardizes his future with a single slap. While touring an Army hospital, the General comes across a GI (Tim Considine) suffering from nervous fatigue. Incensed by what he considers a slacker, Patton smacks the poor soldier and orders him to get well in a hurry. This incident results in his losing his command-and, by extension, missing out on D-Day. In his final campaign, Patton leads the US 3rd Army through Europe. Unabashedly flamboyant, Patton remains a valuable resource, but ultimately proves too much of a "loose cannon" in comparison to the more level-headed tactics of his old friend Omar Bradley (Karl Malden). Patton won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Scott, an award that he refused. Relive the classic war drama in this special new set(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: In this thriller starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe and Freddie Prinze Jr., four youngsters run over a stranger who supposedly dies. Fearing the consequences of the accident, they decide to throw the body into the sea. A year later, they meet again and one of the girls receives a note saying, I Know What You Did Last Summer. From then on, one death follows another(n)

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: In Iain Softley's thriller a group of New York students try to avert a major money scam after hacking into the wrong computer system at the wrong time. Jonny Lee Miller and Angelina Jolie star as the teenage cyber-renegades fighting both authority and The Plague (Fisher Stevens)(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: After an assassination attempt on the American President (William Hurt) during a meeting of world leaders in Salamanca, a secret service agent attempts to piece together who was responsible. The event is replayed through the eyes of six different witnesses, each time from their individual perspective. Each time a little more is revealed about what really happened, with a new twist just when you think you have it all figured out(n)

programme.title: In Like Flint
programme.desc: Spy comedy sequel where the great ex-secret agent is called again as a feminist conspiracy threatens to take over the world(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: Tokyo S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fifty years after he first attacked Tokyo, Godzilla is back on the rampage in this monster opus from Toho Studios. After numerous rounds of combat with Japan's most furious monsters, the robotic beast Mechagodzilla is in for some much needed repairs when a handful of sprites appear before the scientists putting the machine back in fighting shape. The enchanted ones warn the scientists that their actions could have grave consequences, but it isn't long before Godzilla, the most fearsome of all monsters, returns to the scene to prove his might once and for all. What's more, Godzilla is joined by Mothra for a reign of terror that threatens to devastate the island. With few alternatives, Japan's leaders pit the repaired Mechagodzilla against Godzilla and Mothra, but it quickly becomes unclear if the robot will obey its human creators or join forces with the flesh-and-blood monsters(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigate the death of a marine sergeant who appears to have been caught in the crossfire during a bungled robbery, but Tony and Tim find evidence the victim may have been targeted. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when marine corporal Flegman is found shot to death, and a phone leads them to a hotel room where Gibbs awkwardly stumbles upon his ex-wife Diane Sterling and her FBI agent ex-husband TC Fornell. She had been attempting to call her boyfriend Eddie to break up with him, but somehow Flegman had taken possession of his phone. The team tracks down Eddie's car and discovers a clown nose along with traces of blood and he quickly becomes the prime suspect.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of a petty officer prompts the team to once again enlist the help of private detectives The Sherlocks, and their newest recruit - Anthony DiNozzo Sr.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby's homeland security think-tank is compromised when its leader is found to have been murdered, and a theoretical guide to how to pull off a terror attack is stolen.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Benny defends a whistle-blowing US Army analyst from a court-martial, but when he refuses to share redacted government secrets with his colleagues, trust issues begin to develop.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the death of a teenager who was due to appear in court to testify that a man convicted of murdering a Korean couple was not actually the culprit. Meanwhile, disaster strikes when Pope's ex-wife exposes one of his past relationships. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. programme.desc: Part two of two. Brenda discovers she has been given false information while attempting to find a terrorist-linked suspect. She is forced to untangle a web of deceit to determine who she can trust and prevent the PHD becoming the victims of a sinister plan.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A teenager becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his family, and Brenda tries to resist the imposition of budget cuts at LAPD. Detective drama starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.desc: Stage Two. Breast cancer strikes the Archer family---Sterling has it. "I'm trying to stay positive," he says. "I can beat this." But before surgery, he wants to bond with young Seamus (even though he isn't actually the baby's father) and take a Las Vegas vacation(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Placebo Effect. When Archer discovers that the drugs he has been taking for his breast cancer are actually a mix of sucrose and alcopops, he goes on the trail of a Irish gang running a counterfeit medicine business(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Jeu Monegasque. Malory and her agents travel to Monaco on a mysterious mission during Grand Prix week. Archer arrives with $4 million in untraceable bearer bonds, and he's in the mood to gamble(n)

programme.title: Archer

programme.title: Archer

programme.desc: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment. After learning eternal hell is the price for stealing, Lisa decides she'd rather go to heaven than watch pirated cable TV(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer the Heretic. When Homer decides to skip church his time alone consists of dancing in his underwear a la Tom Cruise in Risky Business, watching TV and making waffles(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart Sells His Soul. Bart sells his soul to Milhouse, who swaps it for some ALF pogs. And Moe re-launches the Tavern as Uncle Moe's Family Feedbag(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpsons Bible Stories. During an especially boring sermon by Reverend Lovejoy, Marge fantasises about Homer and herself as Adam and Eve, Homer sees himself as wise King Solomon, and Bart's David goes up against Nelson's son of Goliath(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pray Anything. Coincidences lead Homer to believe he's got a direct prayer line to God, which doesn't stop him from suing when he falls at church(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass
programme.desc: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass. Homer's victory dance at a carnival game leads to fame as a personal choreographer, and a gig producing the Super Bowl halftime show, with help from Flanders. Athlete cameos include Tom Brady, Michelle Kwan, Warren Sapp, LeBron James and Yao Ming(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Thank God It's Doomsday. Homer's convinced the end is nigh. He drags the town out into the desert to meet their maker, but will God actually show up?(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed. Homer heads to Jerusalem with Flanders and his Bible study group, but he is abandoned when he fails to take the trip seriously. Stranded in the desert, he has a hallucination that convinces him he is God's chosen one. With the guest voice of comedian Sacha Baron Cohen(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: In this provocative thriller, a lonely, recently divorced teacher has an affair with a much-younger man. However, their relationship takes a terrifying turn as he grows obsessed with her(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: In this provocative thriller, a lonely, recently divorced teacher has an affair with a much-younger man. However, their relationship takes a terrifying turn as he grows obsessed with her(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Heart of Archness: Part I. Part 1 of 3. Malory hires an adventurer named Rip Riley to find Archer, who has been missing since his fiancée was murdered on their wedding day. Rip finds him on a tropical island, but Archer has no interest in leaving(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Heart of Archness: Part II. Sterling has adapted to life as a pirate king extremely well. He is getting to know the local girls very quickly and the cocktails are going down smoothly. But this is upsetting some of the established pirates, who form a revolt led by the suitably buck-toothed seafarer Bucky(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: First Class Special
programme.desc: Director Matthew Vaughn and his cast discuss the making of the superhero prequel.(n)

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy.(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little
programme.desc: An American couple decide their son needs a brother, and plan to adopt another child - but when they get to the orphanage they are greeted by a charming talking mouse named Stuart, who fits the bill perfectly. However, their jealous cat hatches a plot to get rid of the new arrival. Comedy adventure, starring Geena Davis and Hugh Laurie, with the voice of Michael J Fox.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: First Class Special
programme.desc: Director Matthew Vaughn and his cast discuss the making of the superhero prequel.(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: A headstrong white-water rafting expert embarks on a holiday with her family, but their fun comes to an abrupt end when two killers show up. The fugitives' only escape route from the law is down a raging river, so they take the woman and her son hostage to act as guides. Meanwhile, her husband desperately tries to keep track from the riverbank, waiting for his opportunity to launch a rescue attempt. Action thriller, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Bacon, David Strathairn, Joseph Mazzello and John C Reilly.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: First Class
programme.desc: Telepathic mutant Charles Xavier forms the first generation of the superhero team in the 1960s. Their battle with a Nazi war criminal manipulating the world toward nuclear war gradually drives a wedge between Xavier and his ally Magneto, leading them to become deadly enemies. Superhero adventure prequel, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: The Windmill Massacre
programme.desc: Premiere. Tourists on a coach tour of the Netherlands find themselves stranded when their vehicle breaks down in the remote countryside beside an old windmill that appears neither on their itinerary nor any maps. With no mechanic willing to venture out until the next day, they have to stay overnight and begin to be picked off and dispatched with gruesome violence, realising that their dark secrets have resurrected a local blood-soaked medieval legend. Horror, starring Charlotte Beaumont and Noah Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil: Apocalypse
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice must battle her way through an entire city of the living dead in search of the scientist who created the zombie virus, in the hope of finding a way to stop it spreading further. Meanwhile, the corporation that employed him unleashes the product of its latest deadly genetic experiment on the city. Sci-fi horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich and Sienna Guillory.(n)

programme.title: Marmaduke
programme.desc: An advertising executive tries to start a new life in California with his family and their lumbering, disaster-prone Great Dane. The friendly but clumsy dog accidentally causes chaos for his owners, until an incident at a surfing competition makes him a local celebrity. Comedy, with Lee Pace, and featuring the voice of Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The teenage detective and his future sidekick Watson meet for the first time at boarding school. The death of Holmes's mentor sets the youngsters on their first case, and they discover that former members of an archaeological survey team have died under suspicious circumstances - pointing to a sinister Egyptian cult using hallucinogenic poisons to kill its victims. Adventure, starring Nicholas Rowe, Alan Cox and Sophie Ward.(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little 2
programme.desc: The plucky talking mouse feels left out when the son of his adopted human family makes a new pal - but quickly forgets such trifling matters when his high-flying canary friend is captured by an evil falcon, prompting the brave rodent to mount a daring rescue. Family adventure sequel, with Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie and Jonathan Lipnicki, and the voices of Michael J Fox, Melanie Griffith and James Woods.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: Sin City: A Dame to Kill For
programme.desc: Compilation of four stories of crime and betrayal set in a dangerous city. An honourable thug dishes out some vigilante justice, a private eye falls for the machinations of a femme fatale, a gambler gets in over his head, and a stripper plots revenge. Crime thriller sequel based on the comic-book series, starring Eva Green, Mickey Rourke, Jessica Alba and Josh Brolin.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. He begins in Los Angeles, where he departs from the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to sample Mexican dishes away from the bright lights.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. In New Orleans he calls at a Creole restaurant run by a self-styled gumbo queen, and is given the opportunity to learn the art of alligator hunting.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having sampled some of America's most diverse dietary offerings, Jamie Oliver sets out in search of the country's cheapest culinary treats. In Georgia, he meets family members who have been growing, killing and cooking their own food for generations, and asks them to lend him their expertise at a barbecue contest in Florida. He also encounters the cake-baking Sex and Savannah women, and visits a soul food restaurant struggling to survive in harsh financial times.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The crusading chef reaches the final stop on his tour, a Navajo reservation in Arizona. Here, he encounters some of the country's oldest culinary traditions, and is given a crash course in the tribe's spirituality. However, he is disappointed to see the extent to which Navajo children are becoming reliant on junk food, and sets out to help them embrace their heritage by introducing them to Native American versions of fast food.(n)
