programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. Meanwhile, Jed's scarecrow in the barn is mistaken for a human body, and Marlene enrols on a mail-order reiki healing course as part of a plan to create a massage parlour and beauty salon at the farm.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Barker and Corbett present more classic comedy sketches, with a song from Tina Charles and another episode in the gripping period drama Hampton Wick.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage sketches from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Fancy Dress Party, Smart Cooking with Lionel Smart, and classic serial Hampton Wick. With music from Tina Charles.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Nick Park's Bafta-winning film which introduced the animated inventor and his faithful canine sidekick to the world. Wallace is distraught when his cheese supplies run out, so he decides to take a trip to the moon. All he needs to do is build himself a rocket. With the voice of Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.desc: Nick Park's Oscar-winning animation featuring the bumbling inventor and his faithful dog, whose lives are turned upside down after foolishly offering board and lodgings to villainous penguin Feathers McGraw. With the voice of Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Close Shave
programme.desc: Nick Park's Oscar-winning animated characters embark on their third adventure. Wallace falls in love with the proprietor of the local wool shop - only for Gromit to be framed for sheep rustling. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Anne Reid.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a `cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del feels down on his luck after the council rejects his application for a home improvement grant, but his spirits are raised when he hears about a fancy-dress party across town. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield star as the wheeler-dealers in the first part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy. With Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Douglas Hodge and Angela Bruce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del buys a new manual to help him show Raquel more appreciation and give him the confidence to make positive decisions. Unfortunately, as a result of such upbeat thinking, the Trotters' cash flow hits an all-time low and an angry punter is left baying for blood. The second part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason, Tessa Peake-Jones and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Raquel invites her estranged parents around for dinner, and Del-Boy is keen to make an impression - but a mix-up with the gravy boat puts a damper on proceedings. However, things soon take a turn for the better when Del's `father-in-law' finds an old watch among the Trotters' junk, which he claims could net them a pretty packet at auction. But nothing can quite prepare them for the shock they have in store. The final part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: If They Could See Us Now.
programme.desc: Five years after finally achieving their lifelong dream of becoming millionaires, the Trotter brothers jet off to Monte Carlo with their wives and little Damien - but another dodgy deal by Del sees them scarpering back home and straight to the bankruptcy court. As the despondent duo come to terms with losing their fortune, they receive shocking news about Uncle Albert. Christmas special from 2001.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After a taste of the high life, Del-Boy and Rodney are back in Nelson Mandela House and back in business as Trotters Independent Traders. When they receive an invitation to a cross-Channel Navy reunion intended for dear-departed Uncle Albert, Del spies the opportunity to make a few quid on a booze cruise. The only problem is, Rodney is now the company's managing director and would never approve. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, John Challis and Tessa Peake-Jones star in the 2002 Christmas special.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2003. As Rodney and Cassandra prepare for the arrival of their own little plonker, the Trotter brothers must raise the money they need to pay back the Inland Revenue or risk losing their cherished flat in Nelson Mandela House - but an old photo soon takes the plot into much darker territory. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong and John Challis star in the last-ever episode.(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Wisecracking Detroit detective Axel Foley returns to Los Angeles to investigate the shooting of an old friend, and uncovers a connection with a spate of violent robberies carried out by a criminal who leaves a mysterious calling card. Comedy thriller sequel, with Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, John Ashton, Ronny Cox and Brigitte Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Eddie Izzard: Force Majeure
programme.desc: A stand-up performance from the comedian, offering a glimpse into the mind of the master surrealist. The show was recorded during Izzard's mammoth 2013-14 tour, which saw him visit 27 countries across the world.(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks Live: Revelations
programme.desc: A 1993 performance by the outspoken American stand-up comedian, recorded at the Dominion Theatre in London. Hicks rattles through his opinions and observations on Los Angeles, how much he misses smoking, politician George W Bush, the first Iraq war, the assassination of JFK, pop music, television and children on planes.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: The comedian examines the notion of national identities, and questions their origins, what they really mean and whether any of them have solid historical grounds or are only mechanisms for people to feel better about themselves. Featuring a guest appearance by Alan Moore, author of graphic novels including Watchmen and V for Vendetta.(n)

programme.title: Steve Coogan: Live 'n' Lewd
programme.desc: A 1994 performance by the actor and comedian, featuring characters including foul-mouthed Mancunian Paul Calf and his sister Pauline, aspiring comic Duncan Thickett and handyman Ernest Moss. The show also includes an appearance by John Thomson in his guise as entertainer Bernard Righton.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: First episode of the black comedy written by and starring Julia Davis. Manipulative beauty salon owner Jill responds to the news of her husband's cancer diagnosis by pretending that he has already died, hoping to enjoy the sympathy for being a widow and seduce her new neighbour. With Angus Deayton and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: First episode of Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French as the new vicar of a sleepy English village. Her arrival causes consternation among the locals - particularly stuffy councillor David Horton, who vows to have her ejected at all costs. Gary Waldhorn, James Fleet and Emma Chambers co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: The Songs of Praise crew visits Dibley to record a programme in the village church. However, when Geraldine develops a crush on the producer her wayward emotions threaten to plunge the proceedings into disaster. Comedy, guest starring Peter Capaldi (The Thick of It).(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine's hopes of romance are fuelled by a visit from David's handsome brother, while the Hortons return from honeymoon with a souvenir they had not bargained for - Alice is pregnant. The only problem is, she doesn't know it yet. Clerical comedy, starring Dawn French and Emma Chambers.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Alice and Hugo's baby is christened. The godparents are chosen, the Bishop of Mulberry officiates, and David asks Geraldine to marry him. She consents to his proposal - until sense prevails. Comedy, guest starring Sean Bean, with Dawn French, Gary Waldhorn, James Fleet and Emma Chambers.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: A summer water shortage presents problems for the locals, especially Alice, whose lack of clean clothes forces her to wear a Wonder Woman outfit instead. The parched residents soon see events turned on their head as the water company offers to resolve the problem by flooding the village to create a reservoir.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine tries to make the supreme sacrifice by giving up chocolate for Lent. Mrs Cropley's also being good, vowing to steer clear of lard and fishpaste pancakes, and even Jim has a bash at self-denial. Meanwhile, Alice's unwavering belief in the Dibley Bunny is ridiculed. Easter special from 1996.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: The villagers celebrate Christmas, and vicar Geraldine learns there is a heavy price to be paid for her kindness when she agrees to attend three slap-up lunches and takes part in a Brussels sprout-eating competition. Festive special from 1996, guest starring Peter Capaldi and Mel Giedroyc.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: First episode of Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French as the new vicar of a sleepy English village. programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine is keen to find a celebrity to open the autumn fair in style - and Alice inadvertently comes up with the ideal candidate by letting slip she is related to one Reg Dwight - AKA Elton John. Comedy, starring Dawn French, and Emma Chambers with a guest appearance by Kylie Minogue.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: A violent storm destroys St Barnabas's stained glass window, and Geraldine is put in charge of raising funds to replace it - but the others are unsure whether any of her outlandish ideas will actually work. Comedy, starring Dawn French, Gary Waldhorn, James Fleet, Emma Chambers and Liz Smith.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Local election fever hits the village and Geraldine finds she is a more popular candidate with the voters than over-confident parish council chairman David. Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: A funeral for a pet bird inspires Geraldine to transform the church into an ark and hold a special service for the animals of the village - but David is far from impressed by her stunt. Comedy, starring Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: Maverick cop Axel Foley returns to Los Angeles when an investigation into a colleague's murder leads him to a Hollywood theme park. He enlists the help of old ally Rosewood to prove the resort is a cover for a major counterfeiting ring connected to a terrorist conspiracy. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, Theresa Randle and Bronson Pinchot.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan has the misfortune to meet his biggest fan, whose bizarre behaviour proceeds to ruin his already slender chances of landing an Irish TV series. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, with guest appearances by Father Ted creators Graham Linehan and Arthur Mathews.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan jumps for joy at the news that his arch-enemy, BBC commissioning editor Tony Hayers, has died in a bizarre accident, convinced it can now only be a matter of time before he is back where he belongs - fronting his own TV chat show. Steve Coogan stars.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef serves up two different dishes using the same ingredients - one for children and one for adults - which are aimed at putting a stop to arguments at dinnertime and cater for busy families and fussy eaters.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef shares more recipes as he prepares a selection of party food at his home in Hampshire, and offers tips on how to make quick and easy dishes that free him up to join in the fun.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The double Michelin-starred chef creates new versions of some of Britain's favourite recipes, elevating everyday, ordinary food with his impressive flair. In the first episode, Tom focuses on crowd-pleasing dishes, perfect for sharing at a party, including crispy stuffed potato skins with Roquefort and pancetta, pulled beef brisket with garlic coleslaw, and barbecued mackerel. He finishes off with an indulgent chocolate tart that is not only delicious, but also deceptively easy to rustle up.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef creates dishes inspired by some of his favourite takeaway foods, starting with a puff pastry pizza topped with crispy beef. He cooks an upmarket version of a doner kebab in which he swaps the usual lamb for duck and shows how to make a grown-up doughnut stuffed with an innovative chocolate filling that tastes of Turkish delight. Tom also comes up with a twist on the traditional Cornish pasty by replacing meat with smoked haddock and prepares burgers made with real ham to feed spectators at a greyhound track.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef creates dishes for the weekend, when people have a bit more time to enjoy being in the kitchen and cook themselves something extra special. He roasts a leg of lamb wrapped in branches of bay leaves to pack in extra flavour, salt-bakes garlic and lemon before stirring them through wilted greens and fuses Malaysian and British cuisines by creating his own satay roast chicken. As not everyone gets time off at the weekend, Tom decides to cook a weekend brunch for a group of firefighters and serves up the ultimate English breakfast omelette cooked in one pan.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef prepares a fuss-free lemon pepper chicken dish that will even save on the washing-up as it's all cooked in one pan, before spicing up traditional lamb chops with a North African twist - serving them with a courgette and feta salad and an unusual dressing. Tom also puts his spin on some retro family favourites with his quick and easy rice pudding, and a tasty scampi and chips made with fresh monkfish and a crispy batter.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef improves on dishes he savoured in childhood. He recreates his mother's sausage roast, visiting a Gloucester farm to find the best pork possible for use in the recipe. He also cooks his version of lasagne, incorporating a few extra twists to enhance the flavour, and heads to his old school to prepare a pineapple upside-down cake for the hungry teenagers who now study there.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Best Ever Dishes
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates recipes for livening up lunches, beginning with tomato soup made with fresh produce and thickened with bread. He then gives his own twist to a classic ham and mushroom pie, makes crispy duck salad with an Asian-style dressing and visits a steelworks in York to prepare Pittsburgh black-and-blue steak sandwiches for the staff. For dessert, Tom serves up a light muscovado cream topped with fruit that can be made in advance and is the perfect lunch time treat.(n)

programme.title: Perfect
programme.desc: Valentine Warner and Tom Kerridge fire up their barbecues for classic ribs and simple side dishes.(n)

programme.title: Perfect
programme.desc: Allegra McEvedy and Tom Kerridge demonstrate how to cook tasty chicken.(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: When Dave (Jason Lee) introduces Alvin, Simon, and Theodore to his new girlfriend Samantha (Kimberly Williams-Paisley) and her troublemaking son Miles (Josh Green), the chipmunks begin to panic at the thought of Dave proposing to her while on a trip to Miami. Fearing that they will be sent back to the forest if the relationship becomes too serious, the three decide to head to Florida to stop the proposal. Luckily, Miles isn't thrilled with the idea of having a stepfather, so he decides to accompany them on their zany road trip. Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler, and Jesse McCartney provide the voices of the chipmunks. Bella Thorne and Tony Hale co-star. Directed by Walt Becker(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Goofy Tom and rich kid Sarah head to Venice on honeymoon. He's worried about her ex, who has followed them; she's concerned that Tom only wants to watch TV. Either way, they're unlikely to make it home together(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: The story of three childhood best friends who take a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi entertains dreams of Hollywood, Kit is looking forward to seeing her boyfriend and Lucy wants to find the mother she has never met(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: A tribute to "Girls," which wraps its sixth and final season on April 16, 2017(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning visual effects artist Eric Brevig makes his feature directorial debut with this adaptation of the classic Jules Verne fantasy starring Brendan Fraser. When an ambitious science professor (Fraser) develops a decidedly unconventional hypothesis, the mere mention of his name is enough to elicit laughter within the academic community. However, during a subsequent excursion to Iceland, the professor and his nephew make a major scientific discovery that sends them miles beneath the surface of the Earth, where they discover not only strange new worlds, but also encounter creatures so alien they appear to be from another world entirely(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.desc: Having been pink-slipped by ABC for taking the title of his nightly talk show Politically Incorrect a bit too literally, comedian/raconteur Bill Maher resurfaced with a similar but far less inhibited chatfest on the HBO cable network. Telecast live in the late Friday-evening hours, Real Time with Bill Maher included the usual topical banter and broadsides exchanged by host Maher and his politically diverse celebrity panelists, with a new feature added to the proceedings in which promising young comedians were given a showcase for their talents(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Trans Youth. Transgender youth and difficult decisions about medical transitions faced by them and their parents are examined(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Five Oscars went to this enthralling biography of 20th-century icon Howard Hughes. The epic drama details Hughes' glory years from the 1920s to the '40s, when he earned a vast fortune making films and designing planes, while also romancing Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Axis Mundi. Meanwhile, the Murphys welcome new neighbors when Kevin, Nora and Jill relocate from New York, hoping to start a new life(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: A Matter of Geography. Nora gets an offer on her house from an unlikely buyer with a morbid curiosity, but the money could come in handy when she and Jill are on board with Kevin's impulsive suggestion to leave Mapleton behind(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Off Ramp. Laurie works on a book to expose the evils of the Guilty Remnant, and rents office space to serve as a refuge for individuals fleeing the cult, while Tom goes undercover in the silent sanctuaries to rescue lost souls from its clutches(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Orange Sticker. programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: In this smashing comedy, an office bully (Patrick Warburton) roughs up a Milquetoast (Tim Allen) in front of his daughter, and the humiliated dad decides to toughen up. To do so, he calls on a martial-arts expert (James Belushi) to become his coach. Directed by John Pasquin, who worked with Allen on TV's Home Improvement and on the big screen in "The Santa Clause." Julie Bowen, Kelly Lynch, Hayden Panettiere(n)

programme.title: Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
programme.desc: Comedy special from US stand-up Richard Jeni, who riffs on a host of subjects including Americans' obsession with weight, drug abuse, pornography, and the legal problems faced by Martha Stewart(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: An alcoholic millionaire engaged to a wealthy socialite falls in love with a blue-collar girl, but his strict mother threatens to take away his fortune if he doesn't follow-through with the wedding(n)

programme.title: Modern Problems
programme.desc: An air-traffic controller (Chevy Chase) is having the worst luck: first his girlfriend leaves him, and then he experiences a nuclear disaster. His life begins to pick up after he realizes that the radiation fallout has given him magical telekinetic powers. He decides to settle a few scores with his new-found power(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jimmy Tong (Jackie Chan), un taxista que ahora tiene el oficio de chófer, aprende pronto que a la hora de trabajar para el playboy millonario Clark Devlin (Jason Isaacs) sólo existe una regla: jamás se debe tocar el esmoquin, el traje de etiqueta que tant(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Humans. In a live-action episode, Dr. Labcoat, an unscrupulous scientist at the headquarters of the evil conglomerate Pesci Co., prepares for the rollout of a mysterious cure for the virus plaguing New York City(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: With their home planet in danger and no place in the known universe to seek shelter, a desperate crew of miniature alien humanoids boards a human spacecraft in hopes of saving their doomed world. Eddie Murphy stars in a sci-fi comedy that re-teams the longtime comic actor with Norbit director Brian Robbins(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: The critics were falling over themselves to praise this quirky drama that features a stunning performance from newcomer Jason Schwartzman as Max Fischer. Max is his school's brainiest kid by a long way, but he's also the most difficult - and when he falls for one of his teachers, it spells trouble. Bill Murray co-stars as a parent who provides initial solace and then competition for our lovelorn hero. Schwartzman is terrific, but it is Murray who walks off with the movie, along with a plate of carrots(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Upbeat musical spin on John Waters' 1988 cult hit about a plump, socially conscious teenage girl who shakes up things on a TV dance show in 1962 Baltimore(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door in this hysterical comedy sequel. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: A lovelorn composer flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart, only to discover she and her new boyfriend have just checked in(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A teenager with a bright future turns his house into a brothel while his parents are away, falls for a prostitute and earns the wrath of Guido the Killer Pimp in this comedy highlighted by Tom Cruise's star-making performance(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence stars in this uproarious farce about a successful self-help guru and TV talk-show host who finds himself embroiled in a series of comic disasters when he goes home to Georgia for his parents' 50th wedding anniversary. James Earl Jones, Margaret Avery, Joy Bryant, Cedric the Entertainer. Written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Problem Child 2
programme.desc: The devilish Junior determines to keep his dad from remarrying(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and later finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: John and Max are elderly men living next door to each other. They're continuously arguing and insulting each other, and have been this way for over 50 years. One day, Ariel, moves into the street. Both men are attracted to her, and their rivalry steps up a gear(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: As part of a fertility research project, a male scientist agrees to carry a pregnancy in his own body and becomes very attached to 'his' unborn baby(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: When Princess Pei Pei is kidnapped from the Forbidden City, Wang feels personally responsible and insists on joining the guards sent to rescue the Princess, who has been whisked away to the United States. In Nevada and hot on the trail of the kidnappers, Wang is separated from the group and soon finds himself an unlikely partner with Roy O'Bannon, a small time robber with delusions of grandeur. Together, the two forge onto one misadventure after another(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Ben Finn Finnegan is a treasure hunter who has made it his mission in life to track down the Queen's Dowry -- a legendary collection of 40 chests filled with priceless treasure, and lost at sea in 1715. But in his single-minded quest to track down this sizable booty, Finn has sadly neglected his marriage to his loving wife Tess. Tess has grown tired of the hunt, and now she's looking to start her life anew by going to work on the massive yacht of globetrotting billionaire Nigel Honeycutt(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: A mother-daughter team of con artists target wealthy men for their fortunes(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock. When Whitlock is kidnapped, it is up to Mannix to collect his ransom and rescue him before the media finds out(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: As part of a fertility research project, a male scientist agrees to carry a pregnancy in his own body and becomes very attached to 'his' unborn baby(n)

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Two enthusiastic young male wrestling fans watch their idol suffer what appears to be a humiliating defeat and decide to travel to Atlanta, the World Championship Wrestling headquarters, to cheer him up. They learn he is not at all the man they idolized; nonetheless, in a series of hilarious mishaps, they manage to revive his career(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: When the Cuban missile crisis arrives, Christopher Walken hurries pregnant wife Sissy Spacek into the huge, luxurious bomb-shelter beneath their backyard. A coincidental plane crash near their property convinces them they've dropped the Big One and for 35 years, the couple and their son stay put, with Fraser learning ballroom dancing, four languages and culture from Jackie Gleason tapes. Then comes the day he's sent out to find a girl (preferably one who doesn't glow in the dark) and he meets up with Alicia Silverstone, who's more than confused by his manner(n)

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The delightfully hilarious gang from The Peanuts returns after 35 years for their silver screen debut. Join Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus and friends on a new epic adventure while Snoopy tracks down his nemesis, the Red Baron. Charles M. Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. Screenwriters include Craig Schulz, one of Charles M. Schulz's sons and Bryan Schulz, Craig's son and Cornelius Uliano(n)

programme.desc: Five Oscars went to this enthralling biography of 20th-century icon Howard Hughes. The epic drama details Hughes' glory years from the 1920s to the '40s, when he earned a vast fortune making films and designing planes, while also romancing Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: After decades of movies about college sports, the bands who take the field at halftime finally get their day in the sun in this musical comedy drama. Devon Miles (Nick Cannon) is a talented young percussionist from Harlem who wins a music scholarship to Atlanta A & T, a prestigious African-American university. For years, Atlanta A & T has won awards for their show-style marching band, who combine expert musicianship (incorporating funk, R&B, and jazz rhythms into the traditional marching band repertoire) with choreography, dancing cheerleaders, and roof-raising showmanship. Dr. Aaron Lee (Orlando Jones), the school's band director, gives Devon a spot in the marching band's drumline, the heart and soul of a show-style band, but discovers Devon's previous musical education hardly meets his usual standard when he learns that his new drummer can't read music. Devon soon earns a reputation as a stubborn individualist within the band, not necessarily a good thing in an ensemble where a strictly unified performance is considers the ideal. Devon's cocksure attitude and streetwise style doesn't mesh very comfortably with Sean Taylor (Leonard Roberts), a disciplined senior who resents the presence of the upstart freshman in the drumline, and things become even less harmonious when Devon begins making a play for Laila (Zoe Saldana), a beautiful girl who is also being courted by Sean. Songwriter and record producer Dallas Austin, who has worked with Boyz II Men, TLC, and Pink, served as executive producer for Drumline, helped produce the film's musical score, and contributed his own experiences as a marching band member to the screenplay(n)

He then sets out to seek revenge on those responsible for his transformation(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Upon Jake's release from prison, the brothers are reunited and visit the orphanage they grew up in--only to discover that it is in danger of being shut down by the county for failure to pay taxes. With a little help from James Brown as a revival preacher, the Blues Brothers are divinely inspired to raise the $5,000 that the orphanage needs to stay open(n)

programme.title: An American Haunting
programme.desc: The wind whispers ominous warnings of death before a malevolent entity arrives to claim the life of a young girl as director Courtney Solomon brings author Brent Monahan's chilling, fact-based story of supernatural murder to the screen in this tale of terror starring Donald Sutherland and Sissy Spacek. The year is 1818 and the Bell family is a quiet clan residing on a remote farm in Red River, TN. A normal, loving family by all accounts, the uneventful lives of the Bell family begin to take a dark turn when strange noises around the farm are followed by the arrival of a black wolf with piercing yellow eyes said to strike unspeakable fear into the very soul of all who encounter it. As the sadistic spirit singles out the youngest daughter of the Bell family for torment and her frightened parents search frantically for a rational explanation to the chilling events unfolding in their once-happy home, an eerie, disembodied voice promises death from beyond the grave. With the struggle rapidly turning violent and the Bells' desperate prayers for mercy going unanswered time and again, the shocking murder that followed would prove the only case in recorded American history where the death of a human being was directly attributed to an attack by an evil entity or spirit(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified(n)

programme.title: Abortion: Stories Women Tell
programme.desc: Director Tracy Droz Tragos examines the debate over abortion rights in her home state of Missouri by telling the personal stories of numerous womens' experiences in this documentary. Missouri has become a state with some of the most restrictive abortion legislation, with laws requiring mandatory counseling and waiting periods before access to the procedure(n)

The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on. programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to the Circus
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to the Circus. This week's murder victim is Serge Cluvarias (Marek Probosz), the much-despised ringmaster for the Dratch and Denby Circus. Monk is convinced that the killer is Serge's tempestuous ex-wife, celebrated high wire artiste Natasia Lovara (Lolita Davidovich). Trouble is, eyewitnesses to the murder insist that the masked killer had jumped down from a high rooftop to do the dirty deed, then performed a somersault before escaping--but Natasia had fractured her foot two weeks before Serge's death, and has the X-rays to prove it. By the time Monk has assembled the clues necessary to close in on the killer, another hapless circus performer suffers "Death By Elephant"!(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to the Theater
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to the Theater. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Takes Manhattan. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: The Ten Commandments
programme.desc: An examination of the 10 ethical laws that the Bible says were given to Moses by God. Included: various biblical accounts of the story; an examination of each commandment in historical context(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: Beginnings. Beginnings: The Bible's remarkable stories are brought to life. Noah endures God's wrath, Abraham reaches the Promised Land and Moses leads the Israelites out of Egypt(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: Homeland. Part 2 of 5. Joshua conquers Jericho; Delilah betrays Samson; and David battles Goliath(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: Hope. The city of Jerusalem is taken by the ruthless and powerful leader of Babylon, King Nebuchadnezzar. The Jews lose their city and are led on a forced exile back to Babylon where they are enslaved; Daniel is thrown into the lions' den, the Jews are enslaved in Babylon; Daniel is thrown into the lions' den, but when his faith endures and God spares him, the Jews are allowed to return to Jerusalem; the Angel Gabriel tells Mary she will bear a child; Joseph takes Mary to Bethlehem for the census, where Jesus is born; the Holy family escapes Herod's order to kill Bethlehem's male babies; Judea comes under the ruthless rule of Pilate; John baptizes Jesus, who is now ready to take on his mission - and his revolution(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: Mission. Jesus feeds the crowds in Galilee and brings a dead man, Lazarus, back to life. He later enters Jerusalem riding on a donkey - a declaration that he is the Messiah. Jesus turns on the money-changers in the Temple, while Caiphas coaxes Judas into betraying him. The disciples are thrown into turmoil by Jesus' announcement that their shared supper together will be their last. Christ is arrested and condemned to death as the disciples scatter. He is tied up and faces trial by the Jewish elders, despite Nicodemus' protestations. The accusation: blasphemy. The punishment: death. Caiaphas finds Jesus guilty and the crowd outside is told the verdict. Everyone feels betrayed(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: Passion. Conclusion. Peter denies Jesus; Judas hangs himself; and Jesus is crucified(n)

programme.title: The Face of Jesus Uncovered?
programme.desc: Cutting-edge technology is used in an attempt to uncover an image of the face of Jesus Christ(n)

programme.title: The Jesus Strand: A Search for DNA
programme.desc: A scientist and a biblical scholar use genetics technology to search for the DNA of Jesus. Among the relics examined are the Shroud of Turin, the Sudarium of Oviedo and newly discovered bones of Jesus' cousin, John the Baptist(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: (2006) After five previous nominations, director Martin Scorsese finally picked up the Oscar for this taut thriller, based on Alan Mak and Andrew Lau's Infernal Affairs . Matt Damon plays Colin Sullivan, spotted as a kid by gangster Frank Costello (Jack Nicholson), who grooms him to become a successful cop, Frank's eyes and ears inside the force. Leonardo DiCaprio plays Billy Costigan, who comes from a family with criminal connections. Enlisting into the police force, he is sent undercover into Costello's gang. Both sides know they have an informer in their midst and both use their man to try and uncover the identity of the other. As each gets closer to their target, the tension on both sides rise. Premiere(n)

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: Denzel Washington gives an Oscar-winning performance as a corrupt undercover Los Angeles cop tutoring an idealistic rookie(n)

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: Your mind is the scene of the crime. Box-office superstar Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this contemporary science fiction action film set within the architecture of the mind. Written, directed and produced by Oscar® and Golden Globe nominee Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight, Batman Begins, The Prestige), this eagerly awaited follow-up to 2008's billion-dollar blockbuster is yet another visionary tale from a startingly original filmmaker who continually raises the bar with every film he makes. Shooting in London, Paris, Tangiers, Calgary and Los Angeles, Nolan's mind-bending film also stars Academy Award® winners Michael Caine and Marion Cotillard, in addition to Juno's Ellen Page, Batman Begins' Cillian Murphy and Oscar® nominees Ken Watanabe (The Last Samurai) and Tom Berenger (Platoon)(n)

After answering a distress signal from a long-dead planet, the crew of a deep-space freighter returning to Earth unwittingly bring aboard a murderous life form that goes on a gruesome rampage. A masterpiece of suspense - taking a B-movie plot and adding benchmark production values, including Swiss surrealist H R Giger's nightmarish designs - the film won an Oscar for its startling visual effects(n)

programme.desc: Sigourney Weaver returns from the dead as Ellen Ripley, for the fourth instalment of the hugely successful Alien saga. Cloned by a fanatic geneticist in order to retrieve the alien baby inside her, Ripley re-awakens to find mutant DNA in her blood. With the help of a group of bandits who have smuggled on board the ship, including Winona Ryder as Call, Ripley must do battle against the forces of evil once more. However, with the alien actually inside her, Ripley finds she must face up to the demons within herself as well as facing old enemies(n)

Comedy, starring Michael J Fox, Helen Slater, Richard Jordan and Fred Gwynne.(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: New series. Paddy McGuinness presents a new series of the dating game show. A model, a circus performer, a football coach and a salesman enter the `love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: The nationwide talent search, which gives members of the public a chance to show off their remarkable signature skills, returns for an 11th series. As ever, Ant and Dec take on hosting duties, heading backstage to chat with the scores of auditionees queuing up for their chance at stardom, while Alesha Dixon and David Walliams come back for their sixth year on the judging panel alongside veterans Simon Cowell and Amanda Holden. Even at this early stage, reports from the audition recording stages indicate that some of the acts have made a strong impression on the judges - but whether that will work in their favour remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Richard is in charge of the annual egg hunt, but with Sooty hiding the eggs and Sweep making the hot cross buns, their plans for a happy holiday are under threat.(n)

programme.title: Signed Stories
programme.sub-title: Signed Stories: Share a Story: Miss Morgan.
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the Share a Story competition, meeting the competitors and the animators who turned their stories into short films.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Scott, Virgil and Kayo race to save a plummeting cargo zeppelin, which is equipped with a loading claw and fuel source that could prove deadly should the vessel crash. With the voices of Rasmus Hardiker, David Menkin and Angel Coulby.(n)

programme.title: Scrambled
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The police suspect Bean of stealing his landlady's jewellery - but the real culprit is a magpie he's been nursing back to health.(n)

programme.title: NinjaGo: Masters of Spinjitzu
programme.desc: Four ninja warriors battle dark Lord Garmadon and his skeleton army.(n)

programme.title: Teen Titans Go
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.(n)

programme.title: Teen Titans Go
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.(n)

programme.title: Adventure Time
programme.desc: Finn goes on adventures with Jake the dog.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: Aled Jones is joined by Mica Paris, and Strictly champion Ore Oduba, while Les Dennis and Samantha Womack discuss starring together in a new musical production of The Addams Family. Plus, music from Wet Wet Wet frontman Marti Pellow and Ian Hyland presents a round-up of the week's catch-up TV.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Wild Australia with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray concludes his expedition with a visit to the desert. He flies past the Uluru monolith in a helicopter, before he camps under the stars and spotting a variety of marsupials, including the red kangaroo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: James Bond travels to the Bahamas on the trail of two nuclear warheads stolen from a British aircraft. The lethal weapons have fallen into the hands of international crime syndicate Spectre, which plans to fire them at the US coast unless an exorbitant ransom is paid. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger, Adolfo Celi and Lois Maxwell.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: The nationwide talent search, which gives members of the public a chance to show off their remarkable signature skills, returns for an 11th series. As ever, Ant and Dec take on hosting duties, heading backstage to chat with the scores of auditionees queuing up for their chance at stardom, while Alesha Dixon and David Walliams come back for their sixth year on the judging panel alongside veterans Simon Cowell and Amanda Holden. Even at this early stage, reports from the audition recording stages indicate that some of the acts have made a strong impression on the judges - but whether that will work in their favour remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Little Big Shots
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Dawn French meets a pair of eight-year-old tap dancing twins from Los Angeles, a young pop star named Sapphire, and finds herself competing against a world-class speed stacker.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: The big-collared comedian presents a selection of rib-tickling moments that did not make it into the recent series of the panel show, featuring the likes of Kathy Burke, Joe Lycett, Josh Widdicombe, Philip Glenister and others. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Voice: The Winner's Story
programme.desc: A celebration of this year's winner of the talent show, looking back at the most memorable moments from their appearances in the series and catching up with them in the aftermath of their success in the final as they prepare to take up their recording contract.(n)

programme.title: 5 Gold Rings
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Phillip Schofield, in which two sisters take on a married couple to answer visual questions by placing rings on an LED floor in five increasingly difficult stages. Viewers can play along using the series app. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The detective interrogates a mysterious Dane who has been caught with the dead body of a diamond dealer in his car, and who proves entirely resistant to his questioning. Maigret is convinced his suspect's sister may know something, but soon discovers that everyone in the small rural town where they live is hiding something. Guest starring Tom Wlaschiha (Game of Thrones) and Kevin McNally (the Pirates of the Caribbean movies).(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: As Riggs and Murtaugh examine the murder of one of Los Angeles' fashion expeditors, they follow a trail of evidence that leads them to an ongoing and dangerous underground investigation led by the Drug Enforcement Administration. Trish and the kids are away visiting colleges, leaving Murtaugh to his own devices, while Riggs has trouble sleeping through the night due to his all-too-real dreams of Miranda. Clayne Crawford, Damon Wayans, Floriana Lima and Keesha Sharp star.(n)

programme.title: The Nightly Show
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights of the seventh week of the entertainment show, which featured Jason Manford taking over as host to present a mix of topical monologues, studio games, celebrity guests, stand-up and video clips.(n)

programme.title: Premiership Rugby Union
programme.desc: Mark Durden-Smith and David Flatman present action from the 20th round of fixtures, which included Harlequins v Exeter Chiefs at The Stoop, Bristol v Wasps at Ashton Gate, and Northampton Saints v Saracens at Stadium mk.(n)

programme.title: The Hot Desk
programme.desc: The Geordie Shore star receives a grilling in an interview over the Hot Desk from Dave Berry, Emma Willis, Nicole Appleton and Mel Blatt.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Omnibus. Victoria feels unwell, and begins to hope she might be pregnant. She seeks advice, but in the process, she accidentally gives away someone else's secret. Gabby struggles to cope with her father's death and lashes out, while Robert feels under pressure from Ross.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Omnibus. Sally is horrified to read her own obituary in the paper, and then receives a shocking parcel. Meanwhile, Peter is arrested on an assault charge, and Maria tries to wind Aidan up by flirting with David.(n)

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show bows out in a live finale from Disney World, Florida. The pair will be making sure to end things in a suitably extravagant manner. Co-hosts Scarlet Moffatt and Stephen Mulhern will no doubt be giving fans on the street and in the studio a chance to be part of the action, and Emilia Fox aims to bring the case of The Missing Crown Jewels to a close, as this series' comedy sketch whodunit concludes. Plus, surprise music from CeeLo Green and the final challenge in Ant vs Dec. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance.(n)

programme.title: Grease: Live
programme.desc: A stellar cast gives a live performance of the classic musical. After a summer romance, high school students Danny and Sandy are unexpectedly reunited when Sandy transfers to Rydell High. Recorded live. Starring Julianne Hough, Vanessa Hudgens and Aaron Tveit.(n)

programme.title: Happy Feet
programme.desc: A young penguin disappoints his fellow seabirds with his inability to sing - but instead he displays a remarkable talent for tap dancing. However, his elders refuse to accept this outlandish behaviour and send the youngster into exile, marking the start of a wonderful journey. Animated adventure, with the voices of Elijah Wood, Robin Williams, Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.desc: Nick investigates a spate of sinister burglaries, while Greengrass and Blaketon become trapped underground while searching for buried treasure. Nick Berry stars.(n)

David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in the second in a run of adaptations of Georges Simenon's books. Maigret is distracted from a string of attacks on three wealthy farms by a series of anonymous phone calls from a man who claims a gang is trying to kill him. He and his trusty associates LaPointe and Janvier go in search of the caller, which leads them to the discovery of a body that has been dumped out of a car. Maigret is convinced the corpse is the man who phoned him - but his face has been mutilated, making it impossible to confirm his identity.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for Xun Li, a missing devoted husband and father who has a successful property business, soon escalates into a kidnap and ransom case. However, with the perpetrators cleverly staying one step ahead of the police, it becomes clear that they are not dealing with average criminals. When it appears that the case is closed, Banks and the team are are faced with an unexpected turn of events. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: The team is thrown when a recently rescued kidnap victim is found murdered, with evidence suggesting a local protection gang is to blame. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey

Janet isn't happy either - it's clear her daughter Elise is about to have her heart broken by Eleanor's son Ade. The duo are soon distracted from their woes by a new case involving the murder of a landlord and his wife who were shot at close range in their pub.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey

Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Victoria

Drama filmed in the format of a documentary, guest starring Siobhan Hayes (My Family), Rupert Hill (Coronation Street) and Michelle Gayle (EastEnders).(n)

Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Adrian Lukis and Saskia Wickham.(n)

Comedy drama, starring Albert Finney and Joe Prospero.(n)

When the contest finally begins, Silas is found collapsed on the roadside. Light-hearted drama, starring Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Blue Train.
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James D'Arcy.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victim's apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires

In the face of an impending conflict with Germany, the Great Paxford WI faces a difficult decision. When president Joyce Cameron resigns, taking most of the membership with her, Frances Barden and her supporters must recruit new helpers from unexpected places. Starring Samantha Bond, Francesca Annis, Ruth Gemmell, Claire Rushbrook and Frances Grey, with Ed Stoppard and Mark Bazeley.(n)

programme.title: Harlots

programme.title: Unforgotten

Cold-case crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Rosie Cavaliero, Mark Bonnar, Badria Timini and Lorraine Ashbourne.(n)

programme.desc: A pregnant mare is rescued and the animal welfare officers find themselves in danger when they encounter a pack of fierce fighting dogs.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Law on the Border
programme.desc: The PD K9 unit fights to stop the flow of weapons to Mexican cartels. The officers search vehicles in an effort to unveil the relentless onslaught of guns.(n)

programme.desc: The Nogales PD K9 unit helps Border Patrol rescue a group of undocumented aliens, and search for human trafficking evidence in stash houses.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: Murder Detectives: Solved by CCTV: We See You, Kelsey.
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of millionaire entrepreneur Rick Chance, who was brutally gunned down in a hotel room. To catch the killer, detectives turned to surveillance video for help.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: Murder Detectives: Solved by CCTV: We See You, Kelsey.
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV

programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
programme.desc: A woman finds herself attempting to foil one office romance while debating if she should take a chance on another in this romantic comedy. Lucy Kelton (Sandra Bullock) is a top-flight attorney who has risen to the position of Chief Legal Counsel for one of New York's leading commercial real estate firms, the Wade Corporation. However, Lucy's job has one significant drawback -- George Wade (Hugh Grant), the eccentric and remarkably self-centered head of the firm. George seems entirely incapable of making a decision without Lucy's advice, whether it actually involves a legal matter or not, and while she's fond of George, being at his beck and call 24 hours a day has brought her to the end of her rope. In a moment of anger, Lucy gives her two weeks notice, and George reluctantly accepts, under one condition -- Lucy has to hire her own replacement. After extensive research, Lucy picks June Carter (Alicia Witt), a Harvard Law graduate determined to make a career for herself. Lucy soon begins to suspect, however, that June plans to hasten her rise up the corporate ladder by winning George's hand, leaving Lucy to wonder if she should warn George about his beautiful but calculating new attorney -- and whether she should tell George that she has finally realized she's in love with him. Two Weeks Notice was written and directed by Marc Lawrence, who had previously scripted two other box-office hits for Sandra Bullock: Miss Congeniality and Forces of Nature(n)

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Nancy Meyers' romantic comedy Holiday stars Cameron Diaz and Kate Winslet as two women who exchange houses in order to get a new lease on life. After each suffers her fair share of romantic disappointments, Englishwoman Iris (Winslet) and L.A. woman Amanda (Diaz) meet on-line at a website devoted to helping people exchange houses for vacations. Each agrees to spend the Christmas holiday at the other's home. While each suffers from a minor case of culture shock, both women also end up becoming involved with a man. Iris makes the acquaintance of an upbeat everyman played by Jack Black, while Amanda spends time with a handsome Brit played by Jude Law. Both women must decide what to do with these new relationships as their pre-arranged house switch is scheduled to last less than two weeks(n)
