programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton visits the Discovery Coast of Essex, beginning at the quayside in Maldon on a Thames barge and his first port of call is a small wooden shack that's been converted into a two-bedroomed seaside home. He also visits a development with swathes of glass and recessed balconies. On Mersea Island, he views a converted bungalow, an art deco refurbishment on the seafront, and a detached Victorian villa in Leigh-on-Sea.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp searches for a family home around Hove on the south coast of England for Duncan, Anna and their three children, as they return from seven years living in Switzerland. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer helps couple Mick and Bernie look for a property to downsize to when they retire in the South Downs.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A woman searches for a dream home in West Sussex on a budget of £450,000, allowing her to also pay the deposit on her daughter's first home in London. But it swiftly becomes clear she may have to make a few compromises to move to this expensive part of the country.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity manager Andrew Batsford hosts the first of a week of parties from Hastings, aiming to inspire his fellow contestants with a menu of dishes prepared using foraged ingredients, including sea broccoli and stinging nettles. However, if the food fails to win them over, he hopes a dynamic Wham!-themed evening of festivities will do the trick.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Hastings, East Sussex, and retired solicitor Adrian Carter is hoping to impress his guests with a Moroccan-themed evening. However, disaster strikes when he neglects his tagine, and his rendition of a Rod Stewart classic does not go down well either.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sally-Anne Keller hosts a German-themed dinner party on the third night in Hastings, East Sussex, and requires her guests to dress, sing and dance accordingly. Charity manager Andrew Batsford explains how the principles of anarchism and punk can be applied to football, while retired solicitor Adrian Carter dresses as the 19th-century statesman Otto von Bismarck and raises eyebrows with his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Kate Eadon hosts the fourth dinner party in Hastings, East Sussex, with a menu styled on a gourmet pub meal. Adrian Carter gets himself in hot water, Sally-Anne Keller reveals a surprise celebrity crush, and the host recounts her own encounter with a famous funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The confident Stelios Michael hosts the final night in Hastings, East Sussex, hoping to impress his guests with a Greek-inspired evening. The diners get involved when they receive a masterclass in the country's traditional dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Richard III in Middleham, North Yorkshire, a pub run by Ken Ward and his wife Sharon, who become suspicious when one couple check out before breakfast. The village is known for its horse racing links, but one of the competitors, Matt Wilson, has a fear of horses, and another couple are concerned at staying above a noisy pub.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Court House Unique Boutique B&B in Shelsley Walsh, Worcestershire, where hosts Keith and Lisa Shearin hope to impress. On arrival, Ken and Sharon are blown away by their honeymoon suite and the seemingly low price. Suspicions over price fixing drive Matt and Paul to the internet to verify the room rate, where they discover an anomaly, and despite Keith's best efforts at breakfast, Jo and Louis dismiss it as being too fancy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Castley Camp in Otley, West Yorkshire, for the third day of the contest, owned by single mum Jo Stevenson and her son Louis. Some of the guests are horrified by stains on their bedding and dust in their room, while an afternoon boot camp fitness session reveals Keith's competitive side. At feedback, Jo is left fuming over the comments about cleanliness and breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at the Lion & Swan in Congleton, Cheshire, run by owner Paul Whyle and manager Matt Wilson. A dirty bathroom and a waterbed cause upset, while some guests are still fuming about previous negative feedback. However, the worst is left for breakfast, when Sharon reveals she has discovered their rooms online at a higher price than they were told, upsetting Keith and Lisa and leaving the hosts determined to clear their names.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. First up are Ken and Sharon from the Richard III, who want to learn more about what's been causing Jo and Louis to lose sleep. Next, Keith and Lisa from the Court House Unique Boutique B&B want to challenge Matt about the allegations of price fixing and vehemently fight their corner. Needless to say, there is tension in the air and axes to grind, before the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trucker Tony Houston holds the first dinner party in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, hoping his menu of scallops on black pudding with pea puree, and seabass with prawn mash will impress his fellow diners. However, if his food fails to live up to his expectations, he anticipates the whole ambience and presentation of the evening will secure him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Street hosts the second day in Essex, and has his work cut out trying to impress the diners after displaying some unusual table manners the previous night. However, he hopes his passion for quirky entertainment will be enough to win them over.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Claire Kelly hosts the third dinner party in Essex. Her devil-may-care approach does nothing to dampen her confidence, and she is convinced hers will be the winning night. Even if her chaotic cooking style and haphazard evening fail to win over the guests, the mother-of-two has some special entertainment lined up to gain a few extra points.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and foraging fan Richard Harris hosts the fourth night of the competition in the Clacton-on-Sea area of Essex. Not everybody is impressed when they discover he has had help, and Claire Kelly accuses him of being a food snob. However, he hopes a performance by the local church choir will help improve the atmosphere.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher Kerrie Brinkley-Whittington hosts the final dinner party in Essex, and uses a few props to help her night go with a swing. However, she is soon under fire from entrepreneur Richard, who is not amused to be asked to contribute more to group conversations, and when trucker Tony makes an emergency run to the garden, it looks as if the rhubarb dessert could be just as controversial. At the end of the evening, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare's Tomb
programme.desc: Documentary charting a two-year-long archeological investigation of William Shakespeare's grave at Holy Trinity Church in Stratford-upon-Avon. The grave itself bears a curse condemning anyone who disturbs the Bard's final resting place, reading `Good friend, for Jesus' sake forbear/To dig the dust enclosed here/Blessed be the man that spares the stones/And cursed be he that moves my bones'. For the first time since Shakespeare's death 400 years ago, the church has authorised archaeologists to conduct a study on the site, giving Kevin Colls of Staffordshire University, leading geophysicist Erica Utsi, and Cambridge historian Dr Helen Castor a chance to utilise state-of-the-art radar technology to build up a picture of what lies beneath the surface without disturbing the hallowed site. As the team reveals, the results of their examination contained a few unexpected surprises.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition revisits the changing social attitudes reflected on the small screen in the 1960s, including humorous shows which took liberties in the name of satire, disability being mocked and bulletproof vests being put to the test on live TV. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Peter Purves, Valerie Singleton and Melvyn Bragg.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, revisiting the time of revolution on the small screen in the 1980s. This edition focuses on the concept of fear, dealing with the threats of heroin, glue-sniffing and Aids, Keith Chegwin assessing the impact of video nasties and a young Jeremy Paxman discussing how to survive a nuclear war. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Nigel Farage, Jennie Bond and Chris Tarrant.(n)

programme.title: The World's Greatest Spy Movies
programme.desc: A countdown of the 10 most thrilling espionage films of all time, chosen by real spies and spy-masters from MI6, the CIA and the KGB. The programme untangles fact from fiction, from Le Carre-style gritty realism to the outlandish espionage fantasies of Jason Bourne, and British superhero James Bond, revealing which film comes closest to the truth, and which has won the number one spot.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Are You Right There, Father Ted?.
programme.desc: The priest offends Craggy Island's Chinese community and pulls out all the stops to convince them that he is not racist - but his efforts end in disaster. Sitcom, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn, with Ozzie Yue.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The cleric tries to nurture Chris, the hot favourite to win the King of the Sheep festival, back to top form after he is left shaken by a terrifying encounter. Meanwhile, Dougal becomes convinced Craggy Island is being terrorised by a monster.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Carol Vorderman, Chris Ramsey, Mel Giedroyc and Susan Calman join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Jimmy Carr is the host.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller has a testing time in the country with some exotic patients, while he and head nurse Emma fall in love with a fox that is unable to make it in the wild.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Actor John Nettles and his dog enjoy a walk on the island of Jersey, impressionist Jon Culshaw walks the foothills of Snowdonia with his Labrador Alfie, and Helen Skelton takes Blue Peter dog Barney on a day out in the Pennine wilderness of Teesdale.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton is on the island of Malta, where he meets a couple of serial property-buyers from Ireland, and a financial consultant who has built a gargantuan modern mansion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: NHS manager Helen Mather holds the first party in Leicester, hoping her plans for a simple menu will allow her more time to entertain her guests. However, the accident-prone host has a mishap involving raw pig's blood, and tries to turn the evening around with some `urban ballet' after one diner sours the mood with a display of less-than-polite table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Terry Robinson hosts the second dinner party in Leicester with a `Dress as Your Hero' theme, and the Elton John fan also decides to treat his guests to a song. He is confident his menu will score him top marks, but while Richard is blown away, Ryan remains unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty spa manager Porchia Lee hosts the third dinner party in Leicester, serving up a French-themed menu of chicken liver pate, pan-fried chicken with tarragon sauce and creme brulee. Unfortunately for her the pudding is so bad her guests are reduced to tears, and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping insults her appearance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT enthusiast Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, and tries to impress his guests with a Spanish-inspired menu cooked in front of them. Entertainment is provided by Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts the contestants through their paces in a salsa lesson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Double-glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts the final dinner party in Leicester, and hopes to make up for his boisterous behaviour by impressing the guests with his culinary prowess. In a bid to land higher scores, he puts on his own brand of entertainment, only to reveal a little too much of himself in the process, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets underway at Springbank Guest House in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, where Susan Torkington offers her guests the chance to learn the art of cheerleading. However, the jovial atmosphere is ruined when three stray hairs leave her fuming by leaving time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Old Dairy in Bishops Barton, Somerset, run by former IT consultant Liz Cannon, is the venue for the second day of the competition. The guests encounter a digging session, a big argument and a close encounter with a hot teapot.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Toll House B&B in Saffron Walden, Essex, which is owned by Laurie and Carole Poole, featuring a competitive art session and a disturbed night's sleep for some of the guests. However, the plentiful breakfast proves to be a winner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maria Ettridge hosts the final visit at the Roebuck in Marchwood, Hampshire, where she hopes to entertain her guests with an afternoon lesson in woodland survival skills. However, things go downhill when they are unimpressed with their rooms and two of the contestants clash over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to discover what their guests chose to pay. Tempers flare as the payments are revealed, and the contestants take the chance to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hospital theatre practitioner Geoff Conway holds the first dinner party in Wigan, hoping his nine-course Spanish tapas feast will impress his fellow diners and secure him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outgoing hair salon owner Natalie Crompton hosts the second dinner party in Wigan, and since she loves to party she plans a fun-filled night for her guests - including some very special treats.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Music teacher and funeral singer Alan Gregory hosts the third dinner party in Wigan, and lines up an evening of Greek food for his guests. However, his plans for a cultured soiree are soon spoiled by straight-talking Geoff Conway, who seems intent on causing arguments.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gymnastics teacher Simon Grimwood is hoping to host a special evening on the fourth night of the contest in Wigan, Greater Manchester, because it is his birthday. programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Cameras follow Stefanie and Jade from Harrow who have 10 days to slim down before the launch of their clothing label. Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie also follow the progress of Vicki and Kerry from Chesterfield, who want to get fighting fit for a mud race in four months.(n)

programme.desc: Re-creating the world of the Roman arena, showing how gladiators lived, fought and died. programme.desc: Kids Behind Bars. Acting as a cross between the juvenile system and the penitentiary, Colorado's Youthful Offender System (YOS) aims to break down criminal habits and gang mentalities, while supporting reintegration into society(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Execution. Series telling the story of capital punishment through the eyes of young people whose lives have been shaped by it. In episode 1 for two of the youngest men on death row in Texas, execution day has arrived.(Followed By Weather and iWitness)(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Judgement. This film follows the trial of 26-year-old Guy Heinze Jr, with remarkable access to the jury members charged with reaching a verdict on allegations that Heinze beat his father and seven members of his family to death. As the trial progresses, there is legal manoeuvring while evidence about the brutal killings unfolds(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Crisis Stage. Series telling the story of capital punishment through the eyes of young people whose lives have been shaped by it. With unprecedented access inside prison walls, it discovers what it's like to live with the threat of the death chamber, as well as hearing from victims and their families, and the family of those on death row - some praying for execution, some hoping for a reprieve. Each episode focuses on a key aspect of the system - execution, trial and appeal. The final film of the series follows 25-year-old legal student Kelly Hickman as she attempts to save two of the young killers facing execution in America. Kelly volunteers at the University of Houston Death Penalty Clinic, a team of Texan students who help mount last-ditch legal appeals for killers on Death Row. The team are working on two 'crisis cases' - cases where all of the offenders' normal legal appeals have failed and they are now just weeks away from execution(n)

programme.title: Lost Kings of the Bible
programme.desc: A search for historical evidence of the existence of legendary Bible kings David and Solomon(n)

programme.title: The Hunt for the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Exploring the history and religious significance of the Israelites' Ark of the Covenant, a chest built at Moses' behest (and first mentioned in the Bible in Exodus 25:16). It is said to contain testimony of God's pact with the Jews and the tablets holding the Ten Commandments. Solomon placed the Ark in the Temple at Jerusalem (1 Kings 8:6-9), but it has been missing since the Babylonians destroyed the temple in 586 B.C. This hour includes speculation as to what might have happened to it(n)

programme.title: Search for Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Chronicling efforts to locate the vessel that, according to the Bible, was built by Noah to survive a massive flood. Included: origins of the flood claims; a look at satellite imagery and underwater geological surveys used by "arkologists" in their search. Also: theologians, geologists and archaeologists discuss different ark theories(n)

programme.title: Diving Into Noah's Flood
programme.desc: Archaeologist Jeff Rose searches for evidence of a colossal flood that he believes inspired the biblical story of Noah's Ark. He dives to the bottom of the Persian Gulf to search for flooded settlements, and ventures through modern-day Iraq to investigate(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Revelation
programme.desc: A report on the New Testament's final book---"both a horror story and a promise of paradise," narrator J.V. Martin calls it---examines its prophecies and speculates on the motives of its author, John of Patmos. Was he writing for the oppressed Christians of the late 1st century or for the ages? Interviewed: "Left Behind" author Tim LaHaye; Evangelical bishop Carlton Pearson; journalist John Allen (National Catholic Reporter); and psychologist Paul Watsky(n)

programme.title: Decoding Bible Relics
programme.desc: Experts evaluate the authenticity of religious artifacts recently discovered in Israel(n)

programme.title: Decoding the Dead Sea Scrolls
programme.desc: Theological and archaeological experts examine the ancient religious manuscripts accidentally discovered in caves near the Dead Sea in 1947. Included: theories on their creation; conspiracies surrounding the texts(n)

programme.title: Explorer: The Cult of Mary
programme.desc: A study of people devoted to Mary, the mother of Jesus(n)

programme.title: Gospel of Judas
programme.desc: Take a look at history's most reviled villain from an entirely new perspective as National Geographic filmmakers uncover startling new evidence that offers a heroic slant to the timeless tale of ultimate betrayal. What is the true history of The Gospel of Judas, and how may the text may have been altered since it was first discovered centuries ago? With exclusive access to little-seen evidence and interviews with the world's foremost Biblical scholars, this release may just shake the very foundation of modern Christianity(n)

programme.title: Secret Lives of Jesus
programme.desc: Examining alternative gospels about the life of Jesus Christ, which were rediscovered in the 20th century and offer a different and often controversial view of Christianity(n)

programme.title: Missing Years of Jesus
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the mystery years of Jesus's life. The gospels of the New Testament speak of Christ preaching when he was 12 and his baptism at 30. But where was he in between?(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Dogs
programme.desc: All Shapes and Sizes. In this episode, Ruth Goodman uncovers the surprising origins of the poodle haircut and discovers what gives greyhounds their speed, as well as visiting the ancestral home of the golden retriever in the Scottish highlands. Meanwhile, Steve meets the hairiest dog breed of all and reveals how its dreadlocked coat once acted as lightweight armour. Kate investigates the remarkable story of dogs, all the way back to their ancient ancestor, the grey wolf, through to the Victorian creation of the dog breeds we know today(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Dogs
programme.desc: A Dog's Best Friend. In this episode, the team looks at the special relationship between people and dogs. How much of our pets' behaviour and personality is as a result of their nature and how much comes from us? The team discovers how dogs have evolved to read us better than any other creature on the planet. The team explores the UK's top ten breeds, investigating what makes them the most popular pooches, and takes a look at the future of dogs and at emerging crossbreeds. Ruth Goodman digs deeper into the history of Greyfriars Bobby, one of the most famous dogs in the world, who kept vigil at his master's grave for 14 years. She also visits a pug dog welfare and rescue association celebration to reveal why these lapdogs have their owners wrapped around their little paws and she travels to Swimbridge in Devon, the home of the Reverend John Russell, the man who created the Jack Russell terrier(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Dogs
programme.desc: Martin Clunes narrates this revealing film, bringing you dogs as you've never seen them before. Using state-of-the-art technology - including some amazing slow motion footage - we find out how our favourite animal sees, smells and experiences its very different world. Follow the life of a cute puppy from birth through to its own pregnancy, and hear personal accounts of dogs that have saved lives, rebuilt marriages and detected diseases. Part natural history, part science and part pure celebration of man's best friend, this programme highlights just how extraordinary dogs truly are(n)

programme.desc: The One With Rachel's Sister. In the first episode of a two-part story, Reese Witherspoon guest stars as Jill Green, spoiled-rotten kid sister of Rachel Green (Jennifer Aniston). Showing up at Rachel's doorstep after her parents have cut off her allowance, Jill expects her sister to help her get her life together. Alas, the old sibling rivalry roars into flame when Jill suddenly becomes very, very interested in Ross (David Schwimmer). Elsewhere, Chandler (Matthew Perry) can't cope with the fact that Monica (Courteney Cox) has both a bad head cold and an enormous yearning for his body, and Joey (Matt LeBlanc) picks the wrong time to be generous(n)

programme.title: Big Cats: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee concludes his two-part exploration of the feline family tree, revealing how the Canadian lynx learned to thrive in the snow and spread out, evolving and inhabiting new parts of the Americas. In Belize, he mounts an experiment that showcases the margay's supersharp senses and gravity-defying acrobatics, and heads to the training track with a cheetah to find out what speed it is capable of. Finally, Patrick tells the story of the cat's domestication in Essaouira, Morocco, believed to be one of the first places where one particular species first gave up life in the wild in return for food, warmth, security and a home.(n)

programme.title: At Your Service
programme.desc: Francis and John Brennan come to the aid of a couple who plan to build a restaurant able to seat 100 customers in the grounds of their historic house in Co Kildare, but who have very little experience in the hospitality industry. The hoteliers are concerned when they invite over 100 guests to attend the opening night when work on the building is not finished yet.(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters are raised by their strong-willed mother while their father is away fighting in the American Civil War. Although the eldest, tomboy Jo, yearns to become a writer and her sister Meg dreams of being married, the girls remain firmly united as the family steers a course through hard times and tragic events. Period drama, based on Louisa May Alcott's novel, with Winona Ryder, Susan Sarandon, Claire Danes, Samantha Mathis and Kirsten Dunst.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores the ingenious ways in which ants have collaborated to colonise the planet like no other animal. Natural air conditioning systems keep them cool in their nests, shelters made from their own bodies protect them from the elements, and a strong sense of smell helps them to overpower animals hundreds of times larger than themselves. Plus, a look at recent research that reveals how ant colonies are capable of immunising themselves against certain diseases.(n)

However, when one of them turns out to be true, assassins are put on his trail to prevent the secret from being exposed. programme.desc: A special episode about the life of Mary, Queen of Scots, following her as she stumbles from young girl in Scotland to queen in France, back to queen in Scotland, and finally to Elizabeth I's arch enemy. Plus, the programme meets silver-nosed Danish scientist Tycho Brahe, and Mr H gives his unique take on the epic Battle of Lepanto in another edition of History's Craziest Fools.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Merseyside-based inspector Anthony Joynes travels to south-east Africa to work with his counterparts in the Malawi capital Lilongwe, rescuing two puppies from an illegal roadside vendor and a stray dog riddled with disease. Back in the UK, Graeme Petty responds to a call about two dogs that have been left outside for a long time and he must make a tough decision when the owner returns home. Plus, the programme catches up with Susie, a feral dog rescued by inspector Vicki McDonald. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Richie Rich
programme.desc: The world's wealthiest youngster has everything he could possibly want except friends. When his parents go missing, he must try to keep their fortune out of the clutches of a scheming executive, with the help of some less well-off children. Family comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, John Larroquette, Jonathan Hyde, Edward Herrmann, Christine Ebersole and Mike McShane.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel starts taking regular cigarette breaks to ingratiate herself with new boss Kim and colleague Nancy, even though she does not smoke, while Joey competes with Ross's son for a role in a TV commercial. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Gleason (Boogie Nights).(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Sea Otters - A Million Dollar Baby.
programme.desc: Following the life of a sea otter pup growing up on the coast of California, in an unusual location among the yachts of a marina. Its mother must teach her baby how to avoid the boats and find food in the busy harbour, but an attack by a tough male otter signals disaster for the family. Narrated by Bonnie Greer.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Epic Journeys
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following a thousand elephants as they come together in a crucial gathering in Northern Kenya, while facing threats from both predators and poachers. Liz Bonnin and a team of scientists and filmmakers use cutting-edge tracking technology to follow individual elephants as they cope with daily challenges and make the most of this unique, short-lived gathering. They also capture surprising new behaviour and witness how the elephant society responds to poaching, including the way in which young elephants cope with the loss of their parents.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: The series turns to animals that fly, including footage of half a million mother bats, an agile sparrowhawk raiding for food, and large beetles taking to the sky as part of their mating ritual. The programme also reveals how peregrine falcons are able to reach speeds of 200mph, and why an albatross's nose helps it to fly. Narrated by Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: A 40-year-old man who refuses to grow up drags four reluctant childhood friends back to their home town to recreate a pub crawl they attempted in their teens. As they work their way round the 12 local bars, they stumble on a threat to the entire human race. Sci-fi comedy, starring Simon Pegg, Nick Frost and Martin Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: The staff celebrate when a veteran member of staff chalks up 40 years of service at Greybridge School - although no sooner has he accepted his gift, he drops dead without anyone realising. When Mr Gunn and Mr Church finally cotton on, it's left to the bumbling duo to get the body out of the school before anyone else notices. Fawlty Towers anyone? Meanwhile, Miss Postern has a new poster boy for her anti-bullying campaign - a disabled boy who was moved from his last school because of intimidation. But the well-meaning French teacher soon discovers nothing is as it seems. David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister star, with a guest appearance from Jack Carroll, the young comedian who was runner-up in 2013 Britain's Got Talent.(n)

Lunchtime eating behaviour at a busy sales agency is also monitored, and in Secret Science, Christy Ferguson visits a salsa class to test the theory that if people take their time eating food they're less likely to overeat.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Great Skuas of Inishark Island.

programme.title: Coast Australia
programme.desc: The team explores the state of Victoria, with Neil Oliver meeting residents of Melbourne's historic beach huts and exploring the beacon at Cape Otway that helped give birth to a nation. Xanthe Mallett examines the mystery behind a shipwreck that marked the end of an era, while Brendan Moar learns about the challenges of building the Great Ocean Road in the 1920s. Tim Flannery scours the waters of Port Philip Bay for evidence of an ancient giant marine creature and Miriam Corowa discovers why the coast at Bells Beach produces perfect waves for surfing.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Charisma of Adolf Hitler
programme.desc: Laurence Rees looks at how Hitler formed a connection with millions of Germans and generated a level of charismatic attraction almost without parallel in the process. The first of three episodes dispels the myth that he somehow hypnotised a nation and examines the notion that his alleged charisma played a key role in his success as a leader. With testimonies from those who lived during the era, archive film and specially shot documentary footage.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan travels to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where he realises a lifelong dream by spending time with Grauer's gorillas, the largest primates on earth. He meets the fearsome alpha male Chimanuka and two babies, one a lonely orphan and as Gordon gains the trust of these mysterious, seldom seen animals, he discovers their incredible compassion and gets caught up in a battle between giant rival silverbacks for control of the family.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Hereford.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. programme.desc: Part one of two. Biologist Patrick Aryee explores how cats have evolved throughout the millennia, learning to thrive in inhospitable environments, as well as becoming the world's most popular pet. In the first edition there is spectacular footage of caracals jumping three metres to catch flying birds, and a rare Bornean bay cat, which was thought to have been extinct. Patrick finds out how tigers made the transition from South-east Asia's steamy jungles to the -40C temperatures of Siberia, and meets `lion whisperer' Kevin Richardson.(n)

programme.title: Big Cats: An Amazing Animal Family

In Belize, he mounts an experiment that showcases the margay's supersharp senses and gravity-defying acrobatics, and heads to the training track with a cheetah to find out what speed it is capable of. Finally, Patrick tells the story of the cat's domestication in Essaouira, Morocco, believed to be one of the first places where one particular species first gave up life in the wild in return for food, warmth, security and a home.(n)

programme.desc: The comedian hops across the Channel and jumps on a bicycle to sample the sights and sounds of France, joined by his best friend Noel Lynch, a brickie and cycling enthusiast. The pair start off in Calais with some essential pampering, fully aware that no cyclist worth his or her salt would hit the road without a facial or a leg wax. Then it's bon voyage as they tackle a small portion of the 150-mile race between Paris and Roubaix lovingly known as the Hell of the North. The cobbles may look pretty - but they aren't bike-friendly.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The comedian and his friend Noel continue their journey through France by heading south. Stopping off in Camargue, they are thrown into the thick of an annual gypsy festival and sample the wares of a cosmic wine-maker. The duo move on to St Remy and the Saint Paul de Mausole, a psychiatric hospital that uses art and music to treat troubled individuals - and it turns out one of the centre's most famous patients was Vincent van Gogh. In Monaco, they are joined on their bikes by former F1 star David Coulthard, before Micky makes a splash in a transvestite bar in Cannes.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The end is in sight for comedian Micky Flanagan and best mate Noel Lynch, but before they say `au revoir' to France, they have a few more trips to make. They begin in Marseille, the second largest city in the country, where they learn about the ancient martial art of savate and taste the world's most expensive soup. Then it's on to Lourdes, before a quick trip to Bordeaux to sample a particularly revered bottle of wine and visit a museum dedicated to berets. Their tour comes to an end in Paris, city `de l'amour', where they seal their bromance on the Love Lock bridge.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A coconut salesman with a passion for gay beauty pageants arrives in Sydney. Presented by Grant Bowler.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: An intruder in a shop upsets staff, while some dodgy driving alerts officers to an illegal stash in the offending car. Police officers use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented.(n)

programme.title: A Town Called Eureka
programme.desc: Carter tries to give Allison a romantic honeymoon, saboteurs are uncovered in Eureka, and Holly encounters technical difficulties - which could threaten her existence.(n)

programme.title: A Town Called Eureka
programme.desc: Carter and Fargo try to recollect a cloud of smart dust disrupting all communications in Eureka, while Holly receives a mysterious message that triggers a change in her behaviour.(n)

programme.title: A Town Called Eureka
programme.desc: Allison, Fargo and Zane must try to avoid capture to save their town when the locals start being kidnapped and replaced by body doubles.(n)

programme.title: A Town Called Eureka
programme.desc: The entire town is threatened to be ripped apart by unstable wormholes, forcing Carter to jump into one to stop them. Sci-fi drama, starring Colin Ferguson, Matt Frewer and Jordan Hinson.(n)

programme.title: Farscape
programme.desc: Astronaut John Crichton sets out on a routine test flight, but his ship is sucked through a wormhole to another galaxy, and emerges in the middle of a space battle where he falls in with a band of rebellious prisoners. First episode of the sci-fi drama, starring Ben Browder and Claudia Black.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Major Graham goes berserk with a gun, firing on a crowd before killing himself - and an investigation soon reveals he was a victim of Goa'uld mind control. Anise is forced to get to the bottom of things before someone else is possessed. Sci-fi adventure, starring Vanessa Angel and Phillip Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: O'Neill and Teal'c are exposed to a strange alien device and find themselves caught in a temporal anomaly. Faced with repeatedly living the same day over again they must convince everyone else about what is happening and find a way to break the time loop. Sci-fi adventure, with Richard Dean Anderson and Christopher Judge.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: The team is called in to help when the Russian government encounters problems using a Stargate that was presumed lost after a crash. But when Daniel and Samantha make their way through, they end up stranded. Star Trek's Marina Sirtis guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Daniel is captured and held prisoner by a Unas uncovered during an archaeological dig on an alien world. O'Neill and the rest of the team launch a rescue mission, but soon run into trouble themselves. Sci-fi drama, starring Michael Shanks and Richard Dean Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: After O'Neill and the team help relocate displaced aliens to a new homeworld, another civilisation tries to colonise the same planet, leaving the team striving to discover a fair solution to the dilemma. Sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dean Anderson and Amanda Tapping.(n)

programme.title: Football's Funniest Moments
programme.desc: A look back at laugh-out-loud incidents from the world of Premier League football, including interviews with players, pundits and comedians.(n)

programme.title: Duck Quacks Don't Echo
programme.sub-title: Danny Baker, Roisin Conarty, Jack Dee.
programme.desc: Danny Baker, Roisin Conaty and Jack Dee join host Lee Mack to test out more obscure theories in the studio.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: The best moments from the 11th series of the sports-based comedy quiz, hosted by. James Corden, with captains Andrew Flintoff and Jamie Redknapp and regular panellist Jack Whitehall.(n)

programme.title: DC's Legends of Tomorrow
programme.desc: A huge timequake rocks the Legends' ship, leaving them with no choice but to break the one cardinal rule of time travel to try to fix what has happened. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Stan Lee's Lucky Man
programme.desc: Isabella begins a relationship with a member of the team as she puts a new plan into action, while Harry crosses a line when London's most-wanted criminals are killed one at a time.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham relives its glory days by hosting a vintage ships race and heritage festival, and a local toy-shop owner faces a difficult decision.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham residents raise money for a statue to commemorate fishermen lost at sea, but Pat Seddon's plan to support the cause by participating in a fundraising skydive worries her friends and relatives. Jan Hart goes trawling for scallops, and shares some ancient superstitions.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixham's Crab Festival.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Santos and Vinick go on air for a debate, in a special episode originally broadcast live and unrehearsed in America. Forrest Sawyer is drafted in to raise issues and generally oversee proceedings. Starring Jimmy Smits and Alan Alda as the rival politicians.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Santos campaign faces a dilemma when a scheduled visit to Los Angeles is thrown into doubt when an unarmed boy is shot by a Latino police officer. Meanwhile, CJ intervenes in a dispute between China and Kazakhstan.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As China and Kazahkstan hover on the verge of war, Santos works on his campaign strategy. Ellie prepares for her wedding, while Abbey greets the guests, but President Bartlet is held up by his duties. Carol shows up on the scene, and Josh's job is threatened by disgruntled party loyalists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The vice presidential debate between Leo McGarry and Ray Sullivan looms but Josh remains unconvinced of his candidate's abilities in the public arena. Meanwhile, Santos visits his family in Texas where his brother threatens to cause a stir.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Westins visit Washington, but it appears Doug is harbouring a secret from Liz that many of the other senior staff members already know. Meanwhile, CJ attempts to make a deal with the French in a bid to tackle problems in Sudan, and Josh asks for help with the campaign. Steven Eckholdt guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: New evidence prompts Rush to reopen a 30-year-old murder investigation into the fatal shooting of a rookie officer - but her inquiries anger some older members of the force.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the investigation into a teenage girl's murder when a prison inmate hoping to bargain for a reduced sentence hints that the wrong man could be behind bars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor is unsympathetic when a nun is admitted to the clinic amid claims her symptoms are consistent with stigmata. He believes her swollen, raw hands are the result of an allergy, but is forced to rethink his diagnosis when she suffers an adverse reaction to the medication he prescribes. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor treats a schizophrenic woman admitted with a pulmonary embolism, but soon realises there must be more to her case when she starts bleeding excessively. He finds a tumour on the patient's liver which could explain the blood, but refuses to give up on his theory that the original diagnosis of mental illness was incorrect - and Chase's solution to the puzzle could change the woman's life for ever. Medical mystery drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Jesse Spencer.(n)

programme.title: The Fall: Decker vs Budd
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the controversial sporting moment when South African barefoot runner Zola Budd and American track and field athlete Mary Decker raced at the 1984 Olympics, as the pair meet for the first time since the encounter.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: While investigating a gang-related murder, Danny and Baez learn the accused shooter is an ex-con who is romantically linked to his parole officer.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The men of the Night's Watch face their biggest challenge yet as they prepare to defend the Wall and Castle Black against attacks from the north and south by Mance Rayder's wildling army, with Ygritte determined to be the one to kill Jon Snow. Sam gets some sage advice about love from Maester Aemon and is shocked when someone comes knocking at the gates seeking shelter. Fantasy drama, starring Kit Harington and directed by Neil Marshall, the man behind the second series episode depicting the Battle of the Blackwater.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Jon Snow heads into the wildling camp to try to negotiate a peace with Mance Rayder, but an unexpected arrival changes the situation at the Wall, while Daenerys is forced to make a decision about the dragons in Meereen. Cersei demands that Tywin call off her engagement to Loras Tyrell, Bran learns more about his destiny, and Tyrion receives a visit from Jaime as he awaits his fate. Fantasy drama based on George RR Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Peter Dinklage and Emilia Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.title: Real Time with Bill Maher
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Maher invites three guests from different parts of the political spectrum to discuss the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the life and work of writer and filmmaker Nora Ephron, who is best known for directing films such as Julie & Julia, Bewitched, Lucky Numbers and You've Got Mail. With Tom Hanks, Reese Witherspoon and Steven Spielberg.(n)

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Hood and the gang do their homework for their planned heist at Camp Genoa, Proctor learns his mother is gravely ill and Rebecca has a meeting with rival drug dealers from Ohio.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: A stressed-out Richard struggles to find office space for Pied Piper and riles a nosy neighbour in the process, while Big Head's management style is questioned.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Maritime Inn landlady Pat gets her first full house of the season as Brixham's tourist trade picks up for the summer - but refuses to hire anyone to help her with the extra work. Powerboat instructor Mike Weatherbee tries to enforce the laws of the sea, carpet-cleaner Dave Satchwill prepares to lead the town's popular ghost tour, and lone fisherman Dave Brown reveals his unusual methods.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House is thrown into a state of emergency by the threat of an exploding nuclear reactor, which also plunges the presidential campaign into disarray as the candidates struggle to deal with the situation. Meanwhile, Kate monitors the threat of conflict between Russia and China.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The latest opinion polls are released and in the light of the recent nuclear near-disaster, there are surprises all round. President Bartlet continues to monitor the peace in central Asia and considers deploying US troops to the area. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As the election draws nearer, the candidates begin to feel the pressure of what lies ahead. However, things turn ugly when Bruno spots a chance to damage the Santos campaign - leaving Vinick with a tough decision to make. Political drama, starring Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Santos team decides to get involved with Rock the Vote during the election campaign, and mingles with a host of musical stars. Meanwhile, the Attorney General pressures Toby to reveal the truth about the shuttle leak. Jon Bon Jovi guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two. Election day arrives, and everyone's nerves are in pieces as the staff watch the results roll in. Bruno and Josh begin to question the accuracy of the exit poll numbers, while Charlie encourages CJ to think about her future. With a guest appearance by Foo Fighters.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor is unsympathetic when a nun is admitted to the clinic amid claims her symptoms are consistent with stigmata. He believes her swollen, raw hands are the result of an allergy, but is forced to rethink his diagnosis when she suffers an adverse reaction to the medication he prescribes. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie has to defend his conduct when a teenager dies after he chases him away from a youth he was mentoring as part of a juvenile robbery prevention programme. Elsewhere, Maria goes undercover at a gym after Danny's high-school girlfriend Marianne asks for his help with her seemingly steroid-pumped and violent boyfriend. Guest starring Charisma Carpenter (Angel, Buffy).(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An NYPD officer shoots and kills a 14-year-old boy who was fleeing the scene of a gang shoot-out with police and Frank finds himself and his department under increased scrutiny. Erin is tasked with investigating the case and unearths evidence to suggest the teenager was far from the saint described by the public and media. Danny and Baez look into the murder of a Wall Street securities trader whose gambling addiction had left him deeply in debt, and their inquiries lead to an Egyptian art dealer with connections to Henry. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Mob lawyer Angelo Gallo is shot and narrowly escapes with his life. As Frank looks into the attempted hit, he tries to persuade Gallo to testify against one of his clients. Danny is called for jury duty and ends up reinvestigating the case, while Jamie must stop Jenko from taking the law into her own hands after she is assaulted by a man with whom she went on a date. Guest starring Chazz Palminteri.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank has a fight on his hands when a highly decorated German shepherd in the K9 unit comes under fire when a father accuses it of attacking his young son, and there is a strong public campaign for the dog to be put down. Elsewhere, Baez investigates a murder in which her estranged brother is the main suspect, while Henry gets back into the swing of crime-solving when he tries to find out if the widow of a former NYPD colleague may have had a hand in her husband's death.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez are assigned to investigate a bombing, and encounter tension and resistance from the local community during the inquiry. Meanwhile, Frank has to deal with the political fallout when a man punches an officer who was overly aggressive when questioning him. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Tensions rise at the school when signs of bullying continue, and Madeline's relationship with the play director is put under the spotlight.(n)

programme.title: Guerrilla
programme.desc: A political drama telling the story of two lovers taking a stand amid the racial struggle of 1970s London. Starring Idris Elba and Damian Verguson.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon head to the historic Sos del Rey Catolico, and Rob sees how long Steve can go without mentioning his Oscar-nominated film, Philomena.(n)

programme.title: The Circus
programme.sub-title: The Circus: Inside The Biggest Story On Earth.
programme.desc: A look at the major issues of the 2016 presidential election, examining the stories behind the headlines of one of the most fascinating elections in history.(n)

programme.title: Border Security: Canada's Front Line
programme.desc: The work of officers of the Canada Border Services Agency as its staff enforce customs, quarantine, immigration and finance laws. Whether intercepting suspicious characters, identifying toys packed with drugs or finding weapons disguised as mobile phones, this documentary presents a revealing look at daily life on the front line of national security.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Gordon's orang-utans swap houses with Sally's chimps, but the task of switching habitats proves to be a mammoth operation involving the veterinary team and the primate care staff.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Everything changes for Lulu, Rodders, Ash, Brian and Sally, who now have other chimps living nearby. Meanwhile, baby marmoset Leo is finally well enough to meet his new housemates.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Hananya's chimps are subdued when Cherri loses one of her newborn twins. Elsewhere, a fight breaks out at the lemur enclosure when two new arrivals are given a rough welcome.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison and wildlife vet John Lewis travel to Monkey World's sister sanctuary in Vietnam to release two golden-cheeked gibbons back into the wild.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison heads to Cheshire to rescue four more marmosets. Meanwhile, the primate care staff build a special enclosure to keep baby woolly monkey Bueno Junior safe.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: In the orangutan nursery, all eyes are on Hsiao-quai, who the keepers hope will step up to the mark and adopt the orphaned baby Bulu, who has just arrived from Hungary.(n)

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: The contestants get a taste of the celebrity life when they take part in a paparazzi shoot and a mock cover shoot for Paper magazine. Rita Ora presents the modelling contest.(n)

programme.title: The Biggest Loser USA
programme.desc: The players face a challenge in which they are suspended above water and must keep themselves dry as the rope lowers, with a weigh-in advantage prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: A Nigerian man presents a passport that officers believe to be forged. Meanwhile, a woman suffering from terminal cancer tries to gain entry to the UK and a criminal is apprehended in Calais.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: The enforcement team raids a nail bar in Southampton, where the owner and his technicians are suspected of being illegal immigrants. At Heathrow, a traveller with an unusual name makes an impression on officer Neil Newbury, while the Specialist Customs Unit tracks down people leaving Britain carrying too much money.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom's team investigates the murder of a clown who may have been killed by a rival entertainer. Elsewhere, a counsellor is found stabbed to death, and it turns out he was administering an illegal drug for treating addiction. Suspicion falls on a prostitute he claimed to have cured and a crack-house owner determined to protect his business.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick, Catherine and Sara try to catch the killer of a convict whose dismembered body has been found strapped to the underside of a prison bus. Meanwhile, Grissom and Warrick investigate a stabbing case in which suspicion has fallen on the carer of the victim's mentally handicapped brother. Guest starring TR Knight (Grey's Anatomy).(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom investigates a murder outside a casino and arrests a dangerously unstable man who subsequently dies of liver failure while in custody. However, Nick and Sara discover evidence that this was not the suspect's first murder and find a woman's skeleton buried at the motel where he worked. It transpires she was pregnant at the time of her disappearance eight years previously, so the team has to ascertain if the child is alive somewhere.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A teenage girl dies in a house fire, and the team discovers she had previously written an article exposing the school athletics team's shady initiation rituals, rousing suspicion that she was killed in retaliation. Meanwhile, Grissom uncovers bitter rivalry in the world of competitive word games. Crime drama, starring William Petersen and Marg Helgenberger.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom, Catherine and Nick investigate the killing of a cop during an annual law enforcement race. Meanwhile, Sara and Warrick are called to a hotel room where two other officers have been found dead in an incident that could either be murder or a suicide pact. Both cases are complicated by the fact that most of the suspects are also members of the force.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The body of a world-class sailor is mysteriously delivered to Brennan's doorstep with a note reading `please find out what really happened to me', but with her nightmares about Pelant taking their toll, she finds the investigation difficult. Guest starring Kelly Rutherford (Gossip Girl).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents pursue a killer who disfigures their victims, while Rossi gets a surprise when his ex-wife turns up - with news of the 30-year-old daughter he never knew about.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A prison guard intercepts a communication indicating that convicted serial killer Antonia Slade knows the whereabouts of two kidnapped boys, so the agents engage her in a game of cat-and-mouse in an attempt to elicit the information from her. Frances Fisher guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU agents are spurred into action to prove Hotch's innocence when he is arrested on suspicion of conspiracy. The information they find, however, suggests there may be more to the case than meets the eye.(n)

programme.title: The Catch
programme.desc: Alice and Ben are caught in each other's crosshairs when respective loyalties come between them. The AVI team uncovers one of Margot's secrets. Crime caper, starring Mireille Enos.(n)

programme.title: Nashville
programme.sub-title: We've Got Nothing But Love to Prove.
programme.desc: When `Good Morning America' comes to Nashville to broadcast a live concert in support of Markus Keen's album launch, he finds out he is anything but ready. Luke's relationship with Colt is still strained, and Rayna and Deacon face a big decision. American musical drama, starring Connie Britton.(n)
